Ama will use the loan to purchase fish, sugar, and gari in bulk to resell. With the new profits, Ama plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, sugar, and gari in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en: Zaina is married with four children and two of her children go to school. She has a retail shop and has been in this business for 10 years.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more sugar, maize flour, rice, cooking oil and boxes of soap.  She generates additional income through selling used clothes. She sells to all categories of people but on retail.  She works seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to own a wholesale shop and also to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, rent, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, maize flour, rice cooking oil and boxes of soap

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard, aged 50, owns a store in Mwambalazi. He lives there with his wife and five children. 

He started his business four years ago from his savings. He has grown the business since then, and his income from it helps to support his family. He stocks all the everyday products that people in his neighborhood want. He listens to his customers and stocks new products when he can. That's where Kiva comes in: Bernard wants to stock new products for his store and needs this Yehu Microfinance Trust loan to fund the investment. He will buy foodstuffs, kitchenware and other products that his customers have asked him to sell, especially during the season of Ramadhan- Muslim's fasting holy month. Your loan will allow him to keep his customers, and also provide his neighborhood with a store nearby that they can easily come to. 

Bernard is a hard-working man. He starts his day at 6 in the morning and often works 12 hours a day, Monday to Sunday. He is confident that all his hard work will pay off one day.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, kitchenware and other products.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 48 years old and lives in Tskaltubo district. She has two children: 24-year-old Teona and 21-year-old Revaz. They help Marina to run the family agricultural business. In particular, the family has a greenhouse where during the winter season the family grows greens, tomatoes, and cucumbers. Marina sells her production at the local open market. They sell greens locally and then this production is sent abroad as an export. The family works hard but they still don’t have enough income to expand their business. The total average monthly income of the family 550 Laris.

Marina requested a loan to repair her greenhouse because it is in bad conditions. She is asking for a loan to buy building materials. After the greenhouse is repaired, Marina will plant more vegetables and the income of the family will significantly increase. All members of the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her greenhouse

loans.name: Bena's Group

texts.en:
Bena's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Bena is eighteen years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda. Bena has been working hard to manage her small market which sells types of food like matooke (steamed green plantain) and sweet potatoes. 

To help expand her business, Bena has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh food, like matooke, to resell and will help Bena to generate greater profits and take care of her parents. 

Bena is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food, like matooke, to resell.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a very hard worker who is dedicated to her business. She lives with her husband and five children in the district of Msambweni. She has been running her cashew nuts selling business for over 5 years.

Mwanasiti will invest this loan to purchase three sacks of cashew nuts. This way she will increase sales. She also hopes to better serve her customers. She hopes to increase revenues thus giving her a higher quality of life. Her dream is to help her children finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of cashew nuts

loans.name: Bukurije

texts.en:
Bukurije is forty one years old and married. She has three children with all of them attending school. Before coming to the current location, a little town in the central eastern part of Albania, her family resided in a very rural area where they experienced difficulties in almost every aspect of living.
For the past twelve years or so, Bukurije has been selling dairy to the local market. Throughout the years she has been able to establish a good clientele thanks to her personable nature, attitude towards work and care for animals. She wants to expand her business and buy five more milk cows, yet the loan she is requesting now is for something else, to stock up on fodder for the animals. At the same time her oldest son has been accepted to university and she needs to pay the tuition fees for him as well. 
Bukurije finds herself struggling at the moment, because she doesn’t have saved money for any of the obligations; yet, she believes that if she was given the loan for the purpose requested, the stress that it was causing her lately, would ease up the way she feels.

loans.use: To stock up on fodder for animals

loans.name: Ujamaa Group

texts.fr: L a présidente Chizigire est une femme dynamique du groupe de credit ujamaa. Mariée  à un mécanicien,  mère de 9 enfants tous scolarisés  est vendeuse des souliers au marché central de Bukavu depuis 1994.  Le credit sollicité va lui faciliter l’approvisionnement en 4 cartons de douze paires de souliers usagers.  Son vouloir est de devenir grossiste ; ainsi elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien au femme à faible revenu.
texts.en:
Chizigire is the dynamic leader of the Ujamaa credit group.  She is married to a mechanic, the mother of nine children who all go to school, and she has been selling shoes at the central market in Bukavu since 1994.

The loan requested will help her to get four boxes containing 12 pairs of used shoes.  She would like to become a wholesaler.

She thanks Hekima for its support toward low-income women.

loans.use: to buy four boxes containing 12 pairs of used shoes.

loans.name: Ufunuo Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nsimire est une femme entrepreneur  d’une association d’affaire Ufunuo. Elle est âgée de 44ans, mariée à un homme d’affaire est  mère de 9 enfants tous scolarisés.  Elle est vendeuse de viande depuis  1990.  Le crédit sollicité va lui servir à l’approvisionnement de 120kgs de viande.  La cliente rêve construire une maison d’habitation et avoir sa propre boucherie. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima et prie Dieu de le bénir.
texts.en:
This client, Nsimire, is an entrepreneur who belongs to the Ufunuo business group.  She is 44 years old, married to a business man and the mother of nine children who all attend school.

She has been selling meat since 1990.

The requested loan will help her to purchase 120 kg of meat.

Nsimire's dream is to build a house and to have her own butcher shop.

She thanks Hekima and prays to God to bless this organization.

loans.use: to buy 120 kg of meat.

loans.name: Silvia Yanira

texts.es:
Silvia, tiene 21 años de edad, está casada, tiene un niño de siete meses en casa propia, trabaja en el cultivo de maíz junto con su esposo, de este trabajo han logrado salir adelante, llevan dos años de estar realizandolo.

Ella comprará cinco sacos de abono dentro de los cuales serán tres de sulfato y dos de formula, para esto solicita un préstamo que le brinde los recursos para solventar las necesidades de materiales, gracias al crédito están aplicando los materiales necesarios a obtener una buena producción.

Su objetivo es poder mejorar económicamente al lado de su esposo y de su hijo, tener una condición de vida más digna junto a ellos a través del trabajo que realizan.
texts.en:
Silvia is a 21-year-old married mother of a 7-month-old son. She and her husband own a home and work cultivating corn. They have been in this line of work for two years and have been able to get ahead because of it.

She will purchase five sacks of fertilizer, of which three will be sulphate and two will be complete inorganic fertilizer. For this reason, she is requesting a loan that will help her get the funds she needs to pay for her material necessities. Thanks to loans, they are applying the materials needed to yield a good harvest.

Her goal is to be able to improve her family's financial status and have more decent living conditions thanks to their work.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Ghani

texts.fr: Ghani est une jeune femme agée de 30 ans mariée sans enfants. Elle tient une alimentation depuis 07 ans dans un quartier de la capitale  où elle commercialise les produits de prémiere nécessité.Compte tenu de son expérience, des bonnes relations entretenues avec son voisinage et la bonne qualité de ses produits, elle a acquis une clientèle considérable  d'où  les ruptures de stocks de certains de ses produits.Dans l'optique d' etendre son activité et  satisfaire sa clientèle, Ghani sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra non seulement  d'approvisonner ses stocks de marchandises(sacs de riz, bidons d'huile raffinée, etc...) mais également  d'augmenter de bénéfices. grâce à ces bénéfices elle pourra aider son mari en partie à resoudre certains besoins quotidiens, le reste sera réinvesti dans l'activité pour l'agrandir.
texts.en:
Ghani is 30 years old, married, with no children.  She has been running a general food store for the past seven years, in one of the neighborhoods of the capital city.  She sells staple food products.

Thanks to her experience, to her good relationships with her neighbors and to the high quality of her products, she has been able to build a very large customer base - hence the fact that some of her goods are out-of-stock.

In order to expand her activity and to meet her customers' needs, Ghani is requesting a loan which will allow her to replenish her stocks of merchandise (bags of rice, cans of refined oil etc...) and to increase her profits.  

With these profits, she will be able to help her husband take care of some of the family's daily needs.  The rest will be reinvested in the growth of her business.

loans.use: to increase her stocks of goods (rice, cans of refined oil etc...)

loans.name: German

texts.es: El  Sr. Germán tiene 49 es viudo, su esposa falleció hace bastante tiempo cuenta que fue un golpe duro para el ya que se encargo solo de sus tres hijos que son de las edades de 10, 16 y 14 años, el se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales y frutas como también papa y yuca en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Santa Rita,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Germán va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de sandia y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir,  el Sr. Germán  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara su  calidad de vida  ya que mantiene con esta actividad a toda su familia, El Sr.  Germán es una persona  responsable y trabajadora se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr. German is a 49-year-old widower whose wife passed away some time ago. He states that it was a hard blow for him as he had to raise his three children ages 10, 14, and 16 by himself. He works in agriculture, growing a variety of fruits and vegetables, as well as potatoes and cassava, on his crop field in the community of Santa Rita. This is his first loan with the institution. Mr. German will use this loan in order to prepare his land for watermelon cultivation. He needs this loan in order to obtain the materials necessary for sewing and maintaining his crops. Mr. German faces challenges, such as inclement weather, which has ruined his sown fields on several occasions. He will use his profits to improve his quality of life since he supports his entire family with this business. Mr. German is a responsible and hardworking person who is thankful to the institution for their support.

loans.use: to start watermelon cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cold meats, vegetables, meats, chicken, breads, cooking oil, and seasoning.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine, 38, is married and lives with her husband, Irakli. Ekaterine and Irakli run their own agricultural business. In particular, they have a milking cow and two pigs. Ekaterine milks the cow every day and produces cheese. The family also owns two greenhouses where tomatoes, greens and maize are grown. They sell vegetables, cheese and piglets at the local market. Irakli has a farm tractor and cultivates plot lands. Ekaterine and Irakli are very hard-working but they still don’t have enough income to make some savings to expand their business.

Ekaterine requested a loan to repair the greenhouse because it is old and damaged. She is asking for a loan to buy building materials. After the greenhouse is repaired, Ekaterine will plant more vegetables there and will sell the harvested product for a good price. With this, the income of the family will significantly increase and both members of the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her greenhouse.

loans.name: Mdune

texts.en:
Mdune, 28, lives in Mwambalazi, a town located near Msambweni district, with his four children, all of whom attend school. There, he raises goats for meat, which he sells to customers in his town. He began his business of selling goats for meat when he learned from a relative, who was buying goats for sale, how this business worked. 

Mdune began with a few customers and today supplies stores, granaries, and the community in general. His goal is to expand his business and increase his working capital. This is why he has turned to a Kiva loan, the first loan that he has obtained from Yehu Microfinance Trust, with which he will buy goats in neighboring towns, which offer him a good price to respond to his growing clientele.

At this time his business has the financial indicator of return on sales of no less than 11% and with his investment he plans to make this grow. His dream is to be able to support the professional education of his four children, so that in the future they will be successful professionals who are useful to society.

loans.use: to buy more goats.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha lives with her husband and her six children, who all attend the local school. With a secondary school education, she specialized in the sale of groceries in a grocery store a few years ago. She stocks up at one of the markets in Kenya.

Striving to satisfy her clients' strong demand, which is growing daily thanks to the strategic location of her store, she already established a strong customer base. She is asking for a loan so as to increase her inventory. With the loan, she plans to purchase fruits and vegetables. The profits will allow her to help pay for her children's schooling and ensure that they receive a good education.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Karen Nohemy

texts.es:
Karen, vive con su esposo y un hijo, se dedica a administrar una tienda de productos domésticos, este negocio lo organizó por iniciativa propia para trabajar desde su casa, no tiene un horario establecido para atender a sus clientes.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, frijoles, aceite, huevos, entre otros productos que son necesarios en el diario vivir de los clientes, este préstamo le permitirá realizar una buena impresión y crecer en el negocio, permitiéndose generar mejores ganancias ya que permanecerá surtido.

Su aspiración es a futuro poder tener un mayor número de clientes, como un negocio fuertemente en variedad de mercadería, también invertir en el desarrollo de su hijo.
texts.en:
Karen lives with her husband and son.  She runs a grocery store, which she started on her own initiative so as to work from home.  She does not have fixed opening hours.
 
She is seeking a loan to buy basic goods, such as rice, beans, oil, and eggs, all of which her clients need for their day-to-day lives.  The loan will mean that she can make a good impression on her customers and continue to grow her business, allowing her to generate better profits and remain well-stocked.

Her goal for the future is to have a larger number of clients as a business with a wide variety of merchandise.  She also wants to invest in her son's development.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, and eggs.

loans.name: Aurid

texts.es: Aurid trabajó durante 25 años en una empresa que fue liquidada  y  para continuar activa generando ingresos,  emprendió su propia aventura de negocio hace 1 año. Ella tiene una miscelánea, donde vende artículos varios, como accesorios femeninos, papelería, ropa, artículos para el hogar y detalles para regalos. Su clientela la conforman principalmente amas de casa y jóvenes, que encuentran en el negocio de Aurid muchos productos que llaman su atención, porque ella conoce bien las necesidades y gustos de su clientela y organiza sus instalaciones de manera atractiva para atraerlos, actualizando su estantería en cada temporada con ofertas de artículos ajustados a la demanda del mercado.  Su meta es continuar creciendo y consolidándose en el mercado, por eso realiza sus ventas  bajo las modalidades de crédito y de contado y de acuerdo a las posibilidades de cada cliente. Ella todos los días abre al público desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, porque su meta principal es continuar aportándole al bienestar de su familia, pues en condiciones de viuda y de madre de 2 jóvenes, sueña con verlos convertidos en profesionales exitosos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará vestuario, electrodomésticos menores, accesorios, calzado, que son las mercancías de mayor rotación en la temporada que se acerca y sus clientes la han solicitado y con las cuales aspira a aumentar sus ingresos y continuar su crecimiento paulatinamente.
texts.en:
Aurid worked for 25 years in a company that went bankrupt, and to keep generating income, she began her own journey with a business she opened a year ago. She has a variety shop, where she sells all kinds of goods, such as women's accessories, paper, clothing, household items and things for gifts.  Her clientele is mainly housewives and young people, who find products that strike their attention in her shop because she has a good idea of their needs and taste and organizes her displays in an attractive way to draw them in.  She updates her windows for every season with offers on goods that are adjusted to market demand.

Her goal is to keep growing and to consolidate her place in the market.  For this reason, she sells things on credit and in installments and according to each client's needs.  She is open every day from 7 am to 10 pm because her main goal is to continue looking after her family's well-being, since she is a widow and mother of two, and she wants to see her children become successful professionals.  

At the moment, she is applying for her first loan from Kiva partner the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She will use it to buy clothing, small appliances, accessories, and shoes, which is the merchandise with the best turnover in the coming season and which her clients are requesting.  With these, she hopes to increase her income and continue growing little by little.

loans.use: to buy clothing, small appliances, accessories, and footwear.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara is 57 years old. She is a widow who lives alone in the Terjola district. She has had to deal with great difficulties throughout her life, but her determination to get ahead has always allowed her to overcome them. 

She earns her living dairy farming, with three milking cows from which she produces and sells cheese. Gulnara owns five calves as well. She is a very hard-working woman and takes good care of her livestock. She also works on a poultry farm and gets a monthly salary. Gulnara works hard but still doesn’t have enough income to save and improve her living conditions. Her total average monthly income is 200 Gel, which is hardly enough for food and everyday expenses.

Gulnara has requested a loan to repair her house, which is old and damaged. She will purchase building materials and after repairing the house she will be able to change her living conditions and spend her evenings, after a hard day of work, in a more comfortable environment. Gulnara hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 46 years old and lives in Mwambalazi with his wife. He has eight children, all of whom attend school. David's business is raising goats to sell for their meat. He started his business in 1999 when, with a small amount of capital, he started raising these animals in his yard, fattening them and selling them. He is supported in this business by his wife.

David's business has gradually grown and now his main customers are not only housewives but also restaurants and businesses that sell special meals. This helps his business, as they always refer new buyers to him. David's main challenge is having enough working capital to buy goats. For this reason, he is requesting a Kiva loan to buy more goats. This will help increase his income, which his family depends on.

loans.use: to buy more goats

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is 49 years old and lives in the Tkibuli district with her large family of seven. She has a husband, a father-in-law and four sons (16, 22, 26 and 27 years old). The youngest son goes to the local school. The 26-year-old son, Eristo, works at a petrol station in the Tkibuli District and gets a monthly salary. Lali’s father-in-law is a pensioner. Her husband works as a security guard in the village school and gets a monthly salary too. 

The family's main source of income is their dairy farm. They have two milking cows and pigs. Lali milks the cows every day and produces cheese. Part of the cheese is used by the family, and the rest is sold locally. The family sells piglets in the nearby villages. Along with the livestock, the family owns a vineyard in which they work hard to get a good harvest. They pick grapes in late summer and sell them to local farmers. Although the family works hard, they still don’t have enough income to save and improve their living conditions. Their total average monthly income is 1,000 Laris.

Lali has requested a loan to repair her house, which is very old and damaged. With this loan Lali’s dream will be fulfilled, and she will be able to renovate the house. Thus the family will be able to spend their evenings after their hard-working days in a more comfortable environment. Her loan will ensure better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Silvana

texts.en:
Silvana is a 30-year-old Egyptian woman from one of the two most vulnerable ethnic minority communities in central Albania. She is married and has two children, nine and eleven years old, who, despite their ages, do not attend school. Many Egyptian children here do not receive an education for various reasons.

Silvana has been selling used clothes, home appliances, shoes, etc. for 15 years, at first with her mother and now on her own. “The profit has been just enough,” she says, “only to live a very basic and simple life.” Her dream is that someday she will be able to earn more money and improve the lives of her children, yet this still seems vague for the moment, she says.

Silvana is requesting a Kiva loan to buy more used items. She hopes that lenders will understand her circumstances and lend to her. She is responsible, and she gives her promise to every potential lender that she will repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes, shoes, electrical home appliances...

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a pick-up of wood.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is 39 years old and lives in a small village in the Tkibuli district. She lives with her father and two sons, who are 20 and 22 years old. Lia’s father is a pensioner. Both of her sons are unemployed. Lia earns her living through a dairy farm with two milking cows from which she produces cheese, curds and yogurt. Part of the dairy products are used by the family, and the rest is sold locally. The family owns pigs as well and sells them in nearby villages.  

Lia works hard, but she still doesn’t have enough income to save to improve the family’s living conditions. Their total average monthly income is 350 Laris. 

Lia has requested a loan to repair her house, which is very old and damaged. Thus she will be able to improve the living conditions of the family and spend evenings in a more comfortable environment. Lia hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Alima

texts.fr: Alima est une femme de 39 ans célibataire, mère d'un enfant de 23 ans qui va à l'école. Elle est commerçante et a ouvert une petite boutique qu'elle dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 2 ans. C'est grace à cette activté qu'elle s'occupe de sa petite famille. Ses relations de bon voisinnage, son acceuil lui  permis d'agrandir sa clientèle au fil du temps. Elle a juste un problème dû à son capital qui n'est pas assez important pour augmenter les stocks de marchandises dans sa boutique et éviter les petites ruptures de stocks d'où la necessité de ce crédit qui lui permettra d'acheter  les produits de premières necessité(carton de tomate en boites, savons, spaghetti, sacs de riz et de sel. Elle réinvestira une partie de ces bénefices pour agrandir son activté le resta lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins quotidiens.
texts.en: Alima is a 39-year old single woman and mother of one 23-year old child who attends school.  She is a merchant and for two years, she has had a small store in a neighborhood of the capital city.  Thanks to this business, she takes care of her small family.  Her good neighborly relations and her warm welcome enables her to grow her clientele over time.  She just has the problem of her business capital not being large enough to increase the inventory of merchandise in the store to avoid shortages.  This loan will enable her to buy the staples (cartons of tomatoes, soaps, spaghetti, bags of rice and salt) that she sells.  She will reinvest a part of her profits to grow her business and the rest will allow her to take care of her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy staples (cartons of tomatoes, soaps, spaghetti, bags of rice and salt)

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 35 years old and married without children. Her husband is privately employed and they own their house. For the past year, Doris has been selling charcoal at the market in order to help with the family expenses. She also works as a farmer. Doris has been a member of Yehu for three years.

Doris is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of charcoal to restock her business. Her goal is to open a charcoal depot in future. She give thanks for this opportunity to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram is 49 years old and lives in a small village of Terjola district with his mother, who is a pensioner. He is a former soldier who fought in Apkhazeti and now receives a pension from the local government. Guram is a farmer who cultivates a plot of land where he grows various greens and maize. He works hard to ensure good harvests and sells his produce in nearby villages. Guram is very hardworking, but he still doesn’t have enough income to save and expand his business. The total average monthly income of his family is 290 GEL.

Guram is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and repair the fence at his house which is old and damaged. He will continue to work hard and cultivate greens an maize to sell at a good price. With his increased profit, Guram will be able to reinvest in his family agricultural business and expand it to make it more profitable. This will improve the living conditions of  his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and repair his fence

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla has a business where he sells goat meat. He started four years ago with very little capital, but with God's help and his family's efforts, he has managed to get his family ahead and more competitive every day. Abdalla's business goal is to continue expanding his business. His client base is increasing but he does not have enough capital to respond to the demand. Therefore, Abdalla has come to Yehu Microfinance for his third loan. 

Abdalla is requesting a loan to food supplies in large quantities for the Ramadan celebration -- the Muslim holy month of fasting. Abdalla thinks this investment will be successful because he will have products to offer to his growing number of customers. In the future, he plans to expand his business and hopes to concentrate on strengthening his production to finally fulfill a dream that he shares with his wife: to see their five children grow up in conditions which foster their professional success.

loans.use: to buy food to sell

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es: Cristobal de 61 años de edad es el propietario de un taller de ebanistería,  ubicado en un municipio cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla, oficio en el cual tiene 35 años de experiencia, pues aprendió esta actividad, desde muy joven en el taller de un familiar, donde  trabajó  un tiempo, hasta que en el año 1977, cuando creó su propio negocio organizando un taller donde aun ofrece artículos elaborados en madera, como, puertas, ventanas,  juegos de comedor, sala,  juegos de alcoba, escaparates  etc; En su talles se realizan todas las operaciones del proceso de carpintería, como el diseño, el corte,  lijado, preparación ensamble y tallado de la obra, además de su comercialización; sus compras las realiza en aserraderos reconocidos ubicados en el mismo municipio y sus clientes dos instituciones, los vecinos y amigos del sector, quienes le han recomendado nuevos compradores,  que hoy forman parte de la base de clientes de Cristóbal. Su meta es la de incrementar su nivel de ventas,  adecuar su negocio y reparar su vivienda. En la actualidad su mayor desafío es lograr el capital de trabajo suficiente, para hacer compras de materias primas en mayor volumen y lograr obtener ahorro en los precios por volumen, para ser más competitivo. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a Kiva primer financiamiento que hace a  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará madera, pintura, pegantes e insumos propios para fabricar nuevos diseños, con los que planea impactar  a su clientela y obtener ventas importantes que agreguen mayor capital de trabajo a su negocio y el incremento de sus utilidades, para fortalecer cada vez mas,  el bienestar de su familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 4 a 28 años. .
texts.en: Cristobal is 61 years old. He is the owner of a furniture making shop located in a town close to Barranquilla. He has 35 years of experience in this trade. He learned it when he was very young in his family's shop where he worked for a time until 1977. Then he created his own business by organizing a shop where he still offers items made of wood such as doors, windows, dining room, living room and bedroom sets, sideboards, etc. All of the steps in the carpentery process are done in his shop such as the design, the cutting, sanding, preparation, assembly and carving. He also sells there. He does his purchasing at well known sawmillls located in the same town. His customers are institutions, residents, and freinds from the area. They recommend him to other buyers and are Cristobal's customer base.  His goal is to increase his sales level, outfit his business and repairing his home. At this time, his biggest challenge is getting enough working capital to buy raw materials in greater quantities and be able to save buy buying in high volume. This will make him more competitive. This is the reason he has turned to Kiva for the first loan he has taken out with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, he will buy wood, paint, glue and materials to make new designs. With this he plans on impacting his customers and making important sales that will add more working capital to his business and increase his earnings. This will once again fortify his family's wellbeing. His family consists of his spouse and his 4 children, aged 4 to 28.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint, glue and other materials to make new designs.

loans.name: Mjeni`

texts.en:
Mjeni is a hardworking woman living in Mombasa, Kenya. For the past year, she has owned a retail shop where she sells cereals. Her business challenges include inadequate capital to meet her high demand. Mjeni wishes to expand her business into new markets.

Mjeni is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of maize to sell. She wishes to open another shop in the future and her loan will allow her to continue to offer good services to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize

loans.name: Maulidi

texts.en:
Maulidi  is married with two children ages three and six years old. For the past four years, he has operated an electronic repair shop. He also sells vegetables and charcoal to increase his daily income. Maulidi describes himself as a determined and focused man. His business is located within a busy area and his primary customers are public transportation employees. Maulidi  describes his biggest business challenge as the stiff competition within his area.

Maulidi  is requesting an 8,700 KES loan to buy a water tank for his business. His business goal is to venture into the motorcycle transportation business and he plans to buy a taxi to start his transportation service within the next five years. Maulidi  hopes that in the future he will be able to purchase ten motorbikes.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for his business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La Sra.  Virginia  tiene 45 años con un hijo s de la edad de 17 años, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, actividad que realiza todos los días en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de Cabeza Municipio El Torno,  preparando y ofreciendo a su clientela platos variados, La mencionada actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella y su familia la misma que  desarrolla conjuntamente con una empleada quien le ayuda a preparar y también atender a sus clientes, el destino del crédito es para la compra de un frízer para lograr mantener una despensa llena y fresca,  la Sra. Virginia es una persona muy trabajadora lleva años en esta actividad de la venta de comida está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en:
Señora Virginia is 45 and has one son, age 17.  She makes a living selling food, an activity that she does every day.  She carries out her sales in the town of Cabeza Municipio El Torno where she prepares and offers her customers a variety of dishes.  This activity is the main source of income for her and her family, and is carried out with an employee who helps with the preparation and also tends to the customers.  

The loan will be used to buy a freezer in order to maintain a full and fresh pantry.  Señora Virginia is a very hard-working person who has spent many years in this work of selling food.  She is very grateful to the institution for the help they offer.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz tiene 49 años, se describe como una mujer trabajadora, muy alegre y con muchos deseos de superación. Luz vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en las afueras de la ciudad de Ibarra.

Luz trabaja sola en la venta de fritada, que es la carne de cerdo frita acompañada de mote, arbeja, papas, tostado. Luz también trabaja en la crianza de cerdos que es muy importante para la venta de la fritada. En vista que su negocio cada día crece más Luz decide realizar un crédito a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de maiz, mote, arbeja, papas  y para la compra de crias de cerdo, negocio que le ayudará a obtener mayor producción de los alimentos que vende y mejores ingresos para su familia.

Luz sueña que sus ingresos sean mayores para poder arrendar un local donde pueda acojer a más clientes y brindarles un buen servicio y con esas ganancias poder reconstruir su casa por que está detereorada.
texts.en:
Luz is 49 years old. She is described as a hardworking woman who is very cheerful and really wants to get ahead. Luz lives with her husband and her four children outside the city of Ibarra.

Luz works alone selling fritada. This is fried pork accompanied by hominy, peas, potatoes and toasted corn. Luz also works raising pigs, which is very important for selling fritada. Seeing that her business is growing every day, Luz has decided to take out a Fodemi loan, which will be invested in buying corn, hominy, peas and potatoes as well as to buy piglets. This will help her obtain better production of the food she sells and better income for her family. 

Luz dreams of her income being higher to be able to rent a locale where she can get more customers and offer them a good service and with those earnings be able to rebuild her house, because it has deteriorated.

loans.use: to buy corn, hominy, peas, and potatoes as well as piglets, because she also raises animals.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en: Mwaka is an industrious woman who has been diligently working in her retail shop. She says that her business has been doing well and that her inventory has gone down. Mwaka is therefore asking for her second loan, in the amount of KES 35,000, to restock her shop. With this loan, she will be able to purchase sugar and bales of maize and wheat flour. Thanks for her efforts, her children are also doing well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and bales of maize and wheat flour.

loans.name: Jacobo

texts.en:
Jacobo will use his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to save money and get along better with his neighbors. He’s a hog farmer who lives in an urbanized zone right next to the main church in his county. With his biodigestor, he will treat his pig waste, reducing or eliminating the odor and flies he and his neighbors currently deal with.
 
More importantly, he will dramatically reduce the amount of liquefied petroleum used to cook for the two families living in his home. By taking advantage of the biogas produced by his biodigester, Jacobo will save money and reduce his impact on the environment. He will also save money on fertilizer by using the organic fertilizer produced by his system.
 
This Kiva loan will help pay 80% of the system price.

loans.use: To purchase a 10-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
This is Josie, 43, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Jesus, a seaman, and mother to her three children. Together with her children, Josie manages her household while operating her business. She works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.  Josie operates an office supplies store.  People usually buy from her store since it’s cheaper than the office supplies inside the mall. Her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members. Josie earns a minimum of 600 PHP in sales every day.

Josie is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy more office supplies and expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands. Josie hopes to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partner who gather weekly to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy office supplies and products for her business

loans.name: Malofou

texts.en: Malofou is 54 years old and married with 8 children. She would like to start a small business, doing elei printing (making traditional hand-printed fabrics). In order to do this, Malofou needs a loan to buy more materials, paints, and brushes. She hopes to use her profits to expand the business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy more materials, paints, and brushes

loans.name: Chamanal Group

texts.es:
El chamanal está constituido por dos mujeres emprendedoras que buscan una mejor calidad de vida consiguiendo sus objetivos. La representante de este grupo es Ana quien se destaca por ser una mujer decidida, inteligente y muy responsable en sus actividades, en la fotografía Ana es la chica de pantalon rosado.

Ana trabaja con su compañera en la crianza de cuyes, negocio que les permite ayudar a cada una de sus familias y tener ingresos para su educación superior. Debido a la necesidad de incrementar su negocio realizan un crédito en Fodemi, el mismo que será invertido en la adecuación del galpón comprando jaulas, bebedores de agua, también utilizarán para conprar alimentación de sus cuyes. Negocio que le ayudará a tener mayor numero de cuyes y mejores ingresos lo cual podrá contratar personal.

Ana sueña en tener una empresa grande con muchos colaboradores y poder terminar sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
El Chamanal is comprised of two enterprising women who are looking for a better quality of life and meeting their objectives.  Ana is the representative of this group.  She stands out for being a determined woman who is intelligent and very responsible in her business activities.  Ana is the girl in the pink pants in the photo.

Ana works with her colleague raising guinea pigs.  The business allows them to help each of their families and to have income for their higher education.   Because of the need to expand her business, she is taking a loan with Fodemi.  

She will use the loan to upgrade the guinea pig shed by purchasing cages and water bottles.  She will also use the loan for food for her guinea pigs.  This will help her have more guinea pigs and improved income.  Then she will be able to hire personnel.  

Ana dreams of having a large business with lots of associates.  She also dreams of being able to finish her higher education.

loans.use: to upgrade the guinea pig shed and to buy food for her guinea pigs.

loans.name: Rreshit

texts.en:
Rreshit is in his early fifties, married, and the father of a teenager. His family lives in the central-eastern part of Albania, in a little town that has been booming lately. Villagers from the rough terrain have opted for a better and more convenient life in this little town. Only a couple of years ago, this little town had only half of the residents it does today. Residents here find themselves always doing something related to building construction, whether they build, demolish, or sell building materials. 

Rreshit has always been the sole provider for his family. After an accident three years ago, he started selling lime, which is used for building construction. He is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase lime to sell. In the future, he plans to open a pit and produce the lime himself, in order to reduce costs and, of course, generate more profit.

loans.use: To purchase lime for building construction

loans.name: Hildergard

texts.en: Hildergard is a 54-year-old widow with 4 children. To earn a living, she makes and sells ice cakes and soft drinks in her community. She has 2 years of experience selling refreshments. Hildergard needs a loan to buy plastic cups, flavorings, sugar, and soft drinks. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. Hildergard has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sugar, flavorings, and plastic cups

loans.name: Mouena

texts.en: Mouena is a 46-year-old married woman with 5 children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Mouena needs a loan to buy a sack of sugar, various flavorings, plastic cups, and containers. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. Mouena has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sugar, flavorings, and plastic cups

loans.name: Jaida Johana

texts.es:
la señora Jaida Johana esta casada, tiene 37 años de edad, esta gradada como secretaria, tiene 5 hijos 3 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la compra y venta de joyas de oro, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de su mamá y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de oro y poder mejorar sus ganancias cuando vuelva a vender, espera seguir mejorando y no muy lejano tenga una joyería, ya que actualmente tiene un negocio ambulante.
texts.en:
Ms. Jaida Johana is married and 37 years old. She has graduated as a secretary and has 5 children, 3 of whom are in school. She works buying and selling gold jewelry. She started this business thanks to her mother and so far she has 5 years experience.

She is asking for a loan that she will use to buy gold and be able to improve her earnings when she sells again. She hopes to be able to keep improving and in the near future have a jewelry store, since right now she sells as a street vendor.

loans.use: to buy and sell gold jewelry.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 49 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for her family. For the past three years, Lolita has run a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods, noodles, and other items. 

Lolita is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 20 years old and married with a child. She lives in Calabayan, Ozamis City. For the past five years, Jenelyn has owned and operated a farm where she plants and harvests rice and fruit to sell. She earns 4,000 PHP monthly and she recently joined GDMPC.

Jenelyn is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Taimane

texts.en: Taimane is a 50-year-old married woman with five children. She catches fish and sells them within her community to earn a living. She has been selling fish in the village for two years. Taimane needs a loan to buy a fishing net and other equipment. She plans to use her profits to expand the business. Taimane has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lures, and other fishing gear

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
Federico is 56 years old and married with three children. For the past five years, he has operated a transportation business to earn a living. Federico earns 12,000 PHP each month and he joined GDMPC this year.

Federico is requesting a 38,970 PHP to repair his existing vehicle to provide better service. In the future, he hopes to double his business income.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle to provide better service

loans.name: Charline Bernadette

texts.fr: Charline est une jeune femme de 30 ans mariée mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 2 et 6 ans deux de ses enfants vont déjà à l'école. Après sa formation, elle a ouvert un petit institut de beauté qu'elle gère depuis 2 ans dans un quartier de la capitale. Cette activté lui permet souvant d'aider son époux. Grace à son savoir faire dans ce domaine, elle agrandit et fidelisé une clientèle. Elle aimera acheter ses produits de beauté en gros pour éviter les petites ruptures de stocks et augmenter sa marge bénéciaire. C'est pour ces raisons qu'elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter les produits de beauté pour pédicure et manicure en gros(ongles artificiels, dilluants, vernis). Elle réinvestira une partie de ses bénéfices dans son activté pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra d'aider son époux.
texts.en: Charline is a young 30-year old, married woman and mother of three children, ages 2 to 6, two of which already attend school.  After completing her education, she opened a small beauty salon that she has run for two years in a neighborhood of the capital city.  This business enables her to help her spouse often.  Thanks to her expertise in this domain, she has a growing and loyal clientele.  She would like to buy beauty products wholesale to avoid stock shortages and to increase her profit margins.  For these reasons, she is asking for a loan to buy wholesale beauty products for manicures and pedicures (artificial nails, thinners, polish).  She will reinvest a part of her profits in her business to grow it and the rest will allow her to help her spouse.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for pedicures (artificial nails, thinners, polish)

loans.name: Heni

texts.en: Heni is 49 years old and married with 3 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro that she sells in her community or at the market. Heni applied for this loan to buy herbicide, a plant sprayer, gloves, and plants. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Heni will use the profits from her sales to expand her plantation.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a plant sprayer, taro plants, and gardening gloves

loans.name: Tumema

texts.en: Tumema is a 39-year-old woman who is married with 2 children. She plans to start a small business, driving a taxi.  Tumema needs a loan to buy spare parts and tires for the vehicle. She plans to buy another taxi with her profits. Tumema joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy spare tires and car parts

loans.name: Moana

texts.en: Moana is 69 years old and married with 2 children. She sells ice cakes to children in the village. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a new fridge. Moana hopes to buy new home furnishings with her profits, and in the future she hopes to start a small business making and selling woven handicrafts. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to finance.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Fuaselau

texts.en: Fuaselau is a 33-year-old married woman with 3 children. She would like to start a vegetable garden. Fuaselau has requested a loan to buy spray, a plant sprayer, fertilizer, gloves, and vegetable seeds. She has been a member of SPBD for 4 years. Fuaselau hopes to use her profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, and a sprayer

loans.name: Quintin Nicolas

texts.es: Quintín Nicolás de  44 años de edad, casado con tres hijos menores de edad los cuales están bajo su responsabilidad ya que están estudiando, tiene por actividad una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace 8 años, el negocio lo inicie como una iniciativa propia por la falta de empleo en el país y de dicha forma tener una forma de obtener ingresos para mi familia, y por la necesidad mi esposa tuvo que migrar a otro país para ganase la vida y apoyar con los gastos del hogar, el financiamiento lo quiero para comprar productos de consumo diario como: frijoles, aceite, jabón, detergente, azúcar, arroz, pan, tiste, refrescos, entre otros.
texts.en: Quintín Nicolás, 44, is married with three young children who he is responsible for and who are already in school.  He works in a small store located in his house and has done so for eight years.  He began the business on his own initiative due to the lack of employment in the country and in this way be able to get income for his family.  Out of necessity his wife had to move to another country in order to make a living and to help with the household expenses.  He wants the loan in order to buy everyday products like beans, oil, soap, detergent, sugar, rice, bread, tiste (a traditional drink), and soda, among others.

loans.use: to buy everyday products like beans, oil, soap, detergent, sugar, rice, bread, tiste (a traditional drink), and soda, among others.

loans.name: Matauaina

texts.en: Matauaina is a 30-year-old married woman with 4 children. She grows vegetables on her plantation to earn a living. Matauaina has applied for a loan to buy vegetable seeds, plant spray, and fertilizer. She has been a member of SPBD for 4 years. Matauaina hopes to expand her plantation with the profit from the vegetable sales.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, and spray

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 43 years old and married with four kids. She lives in the Philippines. For the past 13 years, Tessie has been a farmer who operates a banana and coconut farm. She earns 3,000 PHP monthly and has been a member of GDMPC since 2011.

Tessie is requesting a 4,000 PHP loan to pay for her farm maintenance. In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for farm maintenance

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: For 21 years, Leonora, age 41, has earned her living from farming corn and bananas. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Every month, she earns 4,000 PHP from her farming activities. She has five children. Leonora has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC to buy fertilizers. She joined GDMPC in 2011. She hopes to extend the business and plant other crops in order to increase her income and support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert is married with 1 child, and he is 24 years old. He lives in Prenza, Tangub City. Albert raises crops, planting and harvesting bananas to sell in order to earn a living. He has been in this business for three years, and he earns 5,000 PHP each month. He has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. In 2010, Albert joined GDMPC. In the future, he wants to save a reserve fund for future emergencies and purchase another plot of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is from Nailon, Tudela. She is 59 years old and married with 5 children. To make a living, she buys and sells vegetables, eggs, and many other food items. She has been in this business for 8 years and earns 7,967 PHP per month from these activities. In 2008, Erlinda joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more vegetables to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en: Virgie lives in Silanga, Tangub City. She is 51 years old, married, and has 4 children. She makes a living by selling fish. She has been in this business for 13 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month from her work. In 2007, Virgie joined GDMPC. She has applied for a loan to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Sandra Betzabe

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Betzabe es madre soltera, tiene 57 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando, esta graduada como secretaria comercial, se dedica a la venta de medicamentos de diferente clases, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de sus familiares, hasta el momento lleva 7 años de experiencia.

solicita un crédito que lo utilizara para la compra de productos para su negocio: antibióticos, capsulas, pastillas, inyecciones, etc. Espera tener un negocio mas grade y seguir apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sandra Betzabe is a single mother.  She is 57 years old, has three children, one of whom is a student, and she graduated as a commercial secretary.  She makes a living in the sale of different kinds of medicines.  She started this business thanks to the support of her relatives.  So far she has seven years of experience. 

She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy products for her business: antibiotics, capsules, pills, injections, etc.  She hopes to have a larger business and to continue supporting her children.

loans.use: to buy products for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en: Ricky, 35, is a married entrepreneur with 2 children. He is from Dela Paz, Clarin. For almost eight years, he has run a transport service. He earns 4,000 PHP each month. To improve his business, he has requested a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC Microcredit, which he just joined recently, to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, he hopes to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires for his motorbike

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla is from Ozamis City. She is 48 years old and married with three children. To make a living, Perla runs a general store. She has been in this business for 8 years and earns 4,500 PHP each month. In 2007, Perla joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Perla plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Damilde

texts.es: Damilde de 52 años de edad se dedica al comercio de calzado, ropa  y cosméticos, mediante guías especializadas de productos, los cuales realiza a una clientela que ha construido poco a poco desde   que empezó su negocio, cuando simultáneamente trabajaba en una empresa muy reconocida de la región. Ella inició vendiendo entre sus compañeras de trabajo y fue agregando cada vez mas clientela y una diversidad de mercancías, bajo los pedidos que estos le hacían. Gradualmente estabilizó su clientela y agregó a su venta rutinaria,  el comercio de cosméticos por medio de catálogos,  así como el de ropa en el cual continua. En su condición de mujer separada, ha logrado educar a sus 4 hijos que hoy trabajan en empresas y que ayudan al incremento de su clientela, a quien le otorga créditos hasta con 15 días de plazo, razón por la cual su cartera rota rápidamente. Su meta es irse ubicando en su vivienda y adecuar una infraestructura de vitrinas y exhibidores, que le faciliten el impacto de sus ventas en un sitio fijo. En la actualidad su mayor desafío es tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para comprar en mayor volumen, ropa y calzado, para obtener descuentos que se traduzcan en ingresos y en bienestar para su familia y esto es justamente lo que logrará con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el que invertirá en los productos ya mencionados.
texts.en:
Damilde, age 52, sells shoes, clothes, and cosmetics through specialized product guides.  She sells to clientele that she has built little by little since she started her business.   When she started the business she also worked for a company that is very well-known in the area.

She started out selling to her colleagues at work, and she was getting more and more customers.  She added a diversity of merchandise to fill the orders her customers made.  She gradually established her clientele, and she added cosmetic sales through catalogs to her everyday clothing sales.

She is separated, and she has managed to educate her four children.  They now work at companies, and they help to increase her clientele.  She gives her customers 15 days to pay because her capital turns over quickly.

Her goal is to locate her business at her house.  She wants to adapt the infrastructure with display cases and displays that have an impact on her sales in a fixed location.  Her biggest challenge now is the she does not have enough working capital to buy clothes and shoes in large volume.  She gets discounts for buying in bulk, and those translate into income and the well-being of her family.  That is exactly what she will manage to do with her Kiva loan.  

This is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to invest in the products she has mentioned.

loans.use: to buy a greater volume of clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
This is Angie, 54, a resident of Dasmariñas Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Elizalde and a mother. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Angie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages to residents of the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by buying provisions at wholesale prices and retailing them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Angie hopes to expand her business soon, and she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and products for her business.

loans.name: Flora

texts.fr: Flora, âgée de 31 ans, est mariée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés. Elle a un télécentre où elle vend des fournitures de bureau depuis quelques années et se ravitaille dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Soucieuse d'accroître sa capacité d'approvisionnement et de renforcer son activité, elle a sollicité et a bénéficié d'un appui financier à Finadev en vue de maximiser son intérêt et de contribuer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Le surplus lui permettra d'assurer une bonne éducation de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins. Elle souhaiterait élargir son activité.
texts.en: Flora is 31-years old, married, and mother of three children who attend school.  She has a telecenter where she has sold office supplies for few years.  She restocks at one of the markets in Benin.  Keen to increase her ability to restock and to improve her business, she asked for and received financial support from Finadev to maximize her interest and to contribute to her children's education.  The surplus will enable her to provide a good education to her children and to take care of her needs. She would also like to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy 12 boxes of A4-size paper, 5 boxes of notebooks, and 3 boxes of Bic pens.

loans.name: Bona Nathalie Mariam's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe constitué de deux membres en caution solidaire. Bona Nathalie Mariam, la responsable, est âgée de 34 ans. Mariée et mère d'un enfant âgé de 10 ans et scolarisé dans une école du quartier, elle vend de la farine d'igname, du maïs et des oignons depuis cinq ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son fonds de commerce et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev en vue d'accroître son revenu supplémentaire et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. La responsable se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en: This group consists of two members in a joint guarantee. Bona Nathalie Mariam, the manager, is 34-years old, married, and mother of one 10-year old child who attends a neighborhood school. She has sold yam flour, corn, and onions for five years.  She restocks at one of the markets in Benin. In order to strengthen her working capital and to satisfy customer demand, she asked for and obtained financing from Finadev to increase her additional income and to contribute to the education of her children. The manager is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of yam flour, 1 bag of corn, and 2 bags of onions.

loans.name: Bessy Carolina

texts.es:
Bessy, esté solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en su negocio, pues considera que a través de estos recursos logra mejorar su negocio, en esta ocasión comprada pollos pequeños para engorde, ya que ella los alimenta y dentro de unos meses los destaza para salir a vender, adquirira 300 pollos pequeños y concentrado.
Manifiesta que a través de su trabajo y del apoyo que se le ha brindado con estos financiamientos su negocio ha prosperado, logrando tener resultados positivos.
texts.en:
Bessy is asking for a new loan to be able to invest in her business because she feels that through these resources she will be able to improve her business. On this occasion she will buy small chickens to fatten them. She will feed them and after some months she will butcher them to sell. She will buy 300 young chickens and concentrated feed.

She says that through her work and the support of these loans her business has prospered and had positive results.

loans.use: to buy 300 young chickens and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Yolande

texts.fr: Agée de 45 ans, Yolande est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont deux vont encore à l'école. Elle vend de la boisson, du sucre, du macaroni et de la tomate en boite depuis quelques années puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Expérimentée dans le crédit, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement aurpès de Finadev en vue d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et de combler les attentes de ses clients . Ce financement lui permettra de maximiser son profit et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Yolande is 45-years old, married, and mother of four children, two of which still attend school.  She has sold beverages, sugar, macaroni, and canned tomatoes for several years and restocks at one of the markets in Benin.  Experienced with credit, she asked for and obtained financing from Finadev to increase her revenues and to meet the expectations of her customers.  This loan will enable her to maximize her profit and to contribute to the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy 5 boxes of wine, 1 box of sugar, 3 boxes of macaroni, 5 boxes of canned goods, and 4 boxes of liqueurs.

loans.name: Terencio De Jesus

texts.es: Terencio de Jesús de 38 años de edad, casado con 3 hijos menores de edad, tiene por actividad económica el servicio de motosierra, el tiempo de tener el negocio 16 años, el servicio lo vende a los diferentes madereros de forma ambulante y con el tiempo ha podido tener clientes fijos y eventuales, el financiamiento lo quiere para comprar otro motosierra ya que su demanda ha crecido y no se da abasto con la que tiene.
texts.en: Terencio de Jesus, 38, is married and has 3 young children. He has had a business offering power sawing services for 16 years and he markets himself to different timber merchants as an itinerant worker. With time he has been able to create fixed and temporary clientele. He wants the loan to buy another power saw as his demand has increased and what he has is not enough.

loans.use: to buy a power saw because his demand has grown and he can't keep up with what he has.

loans.name: Josue Abacu

texts.es:
Josué, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, ya que quiere mejorar la producción de pan, se comprará latas, harina de trigo, azúcar, otros materiales que son necesarios para la elaboración de pan, esto le permitirá a Josué continuar en su trabajo y mantener un buen nivel de ventas.

Con el préstamo anterior ha logrado mejorar su condición económica y la prosperidad en el negocio, le ha permitido tener una mejor solvencia económica para su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Josué has decided to ask for another loan because he wants to improve his bread production. He will buy tins, wheat flour, sugar and other materials needed to make bread. This will allow Josué to continue his work and maintain a good level of sales.

With the previous loan he was able to improve his financial situation and his business' prosperity. It has allowed him to have more economic stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy tins, wheat flour, sugar.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is from Canibungan Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Elizabeth is married and has four children. To make a living, Elizabeth provides transportation services. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for six years and earns 20,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2004, Elizabeth joined GDMPC. Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Rey

texts.en: Rey is from Cabungaan Clarin. He is 36 years old and is married. Rey owns & operates an agricultural business. He has been engaged in his business for 8 years and earns 8,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Rey joined GDMPC. He is requesting a loan of 20,350 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Rey plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
This is Juliana, 65, resident of Dasmariñas Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Gabino and mother to her children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Juliana operates a sewing business. She makes rugs and she also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php22,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Juliana hopes to expand her business through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for cloth needed in her business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 22 años de edad, ella vive en el distrito de la Tinguiña, Ica, Perú. Ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima calido y sobre todo acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de pallares, esparragos, garbanzos, uva, entre otros y tambien por sus atractivos turísticos como “La Laguna de Huacachina”, la cual es visitada por muchos turistas en cualquier época del año, en su tiempo libre a Norma le gusta pasear con su pequeña hija de 6 años de edad, a quien adora mucho y es su razón de salir adelante cada día, en ocasiones le gusta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz Chaufa”.	

Con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo entusiasmo Norma trabaja en su pequeño negocio de Venta de Ropa, se dedica a este trabajo 5 horas diarias. En un día norma puede atender a 5 clientes y esto le permite ganar gana aproximadamente un promedio de S/. 200 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar S/.300 lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales para el hogar  y para  invertir en el negocio, ella cree que le va bien a sus clientes porque los trata de manera amable y porque vende muy buenos productos. 

Actualmente  está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su apoyo y con ello podrá  mas mercadería para su negocio,  como ropa para invierno entre ellas poleras, pantalones, buzos, entre otros y con ello mejorara sus ingresos y así podrá ahorrar para poder seguir luchando para hacer realidad  su gran sueño: Tener un local propio."
texts.en:
Norma, age 22, lives in the Tinguiña district, Ica, Perú.  The city is noted for its hot, welcoming weather.  Agriculture, especially growing lima beans, asparagus, chick-peas, and grapes, among others, develops here.  The city is also known for its tourist attractions like “La Laguna de Huacachina”, which many tourists visit all year round during their free time.

Norma likes to take walks with her little six year old daughter.  She loves her daughter very much, and she is her reason for getting ahead every day.  Sometimes she likes to enjoy one of her favorite dishes, the delicious “Arroz Chaufa” [fried rice].

Norma works with great effort, and, above all, enthusiasm at her small business of selling clothes .  She does this work five hours a day.   On a normal day she can tend to five customers.  This allows her to earn an average of approximately 200 soles a day.  On a good day she is able to earn 300 soles.  This helps her with some additional household expenses, and it helps her invest in her business.  She believes that she does well with her customers because she treats them kindly, and because she sells very good products.

She is now very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  This is the second time that they have given her their support.   With the loan she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business.  She will buy winter clothes like skirts, pants, and sweatshirts, among others.   With this her income will improve, and she will be able to save in order to continue struggling to make her biggest dream a reality:  To have her own place.

loans.use: to buy clothes like skirts, pants, and sweatshirts, among others.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is busy with her business, even at the age of 54. She sells generic medicines in the nearby villages. She was married to Jesus, a simple rice farmer. She has only two children: Joland and Jijilyn. 

Yolanda sells different generic medicines to the village stores in her hometown. She generates daily net income of 300 PHP through her business. For improving her business, she is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP. She will utilize the loan to buy a sufficient stock of medicines to meet her customers’ demands. She also plans to start a business of buying and selling bagoong (shrimp paste) that can generate additional income. 

As a mother, she also dreams of a more comfortable life for her family and strives hard to attain her dream. She hopes that her business will grow by the help of God and with her patience and hard work.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of medicines

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is married with three children. She is 35 years old and lives in Migcanaway, Tangub City. Anita sells "banana cue" (fried bananas on a stick) to earn a living and had this business for 7 years. Every month she earns 4,000 PHP from it. She has requested a loan of 6,900 PHP to purchase bananas, barbecue sticks and charcoal. In 2009, Anita joined GDMPC. She hopes to increase her savings for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, barbecue sticks and charcoal.

loans.name: Joelita

texts.en: Joelita is a married woman with 3 children. She is 36 years old and lives in Osamiz City. Joelita owns and operates a banana business to earn a living, and she's been in this business for 7 years. She earns 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Joelita has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Joelita wants to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Evelyn Yazaira

texts.es:
Evelyn, está trabajando en su negocio, actualmente necesita comprarse mas mercadería, de la cual a diario consume en la producción de la venta como el quesillo, carne, aceite, tomates, chiles, y condimentos, estos son los que le ayudaran para que ella elabore la pupusas.
Ella manifiesta que estos préstamos le permiten mantenerse ocupada con su trabajo, actualmente está vendiendo pupusas ya que son de mucha preferencia de los clientes, en este periodo ha aumentado sus ingresos, aun sigue con la tienda de productos domesticos, hoy en día tiene una mejor solvencia económica.
texts.en: Evelyn is working on her business. Currently, she needs to purchase more merchandise which is consumed daily in sales production, such as cheese, meat, oil, tomatoes, peppers, and condiments. These are what will help her make pupusas (stuffed tortillas). She expresses that these loans allow her to keep busy with her work. Currently she is selling pupusas since they are a customer favorite. During this time, she has increased her profits. Even with the household products store,  she has better credit today.

loans.use: to purchase cheese, meat, oil, tomatoes, peppers, and condiments.

loans.name: Suhbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Suhbaatar is 53 years old and lives with his wife, Dalaijargal, in a little house in Huvsgul province. His wife is his partner. Since 2008, he has conducted an organic vegetable planting, hay-making business. He is also a professional welder and he operates a welding business. 

He borrowed a loan from Xacbank four times in the last four years. He was good borrower. But he is lacking in working capital, so he needs 4,200,000 MNT to purchase new welding materials and to help in the reaping of his vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase new welding materials and to help in the reaping of his vegetables.

loans.name: Xilomen Maria
