texts.es: Xilonen Maria de 27 años de edad  soltera,  sin hijos, tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general en la cual se desempeña hace  3 años , el negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal, el negocio lo heredo de sus padres, en la actualidad ha aumentado su capital de trabajo gracia  a su responsabilidad DIA a día, y el apoyo que Fundación y kiva le brindan para salir adelante, con el financiamiento comprara mercadería como: pantalones, faldas, blusas, short, camisetas, ropa de niño, jugos de toallas, sabanas, entre otros.
texts.en: Xilonen Maria is 27 years old, single, and has no children. Her work is in the sale of general merchandise, which she has done for 3 years. The business is located in a town market. She inherited the business from her parents. Today, she has increased her working capital thanks to her responsibility day by day, and the support that Fundación and Kiva offer her to get ahead. With the loan, she will purchase merchandise such as pants, skirts, blouses, shorts, t-shirts, children's clothing, towel sets, and sheets, among other things.

loans.use: to purchase pants, skirts, blouses, shorts, t-shirts, children's clothing, towel sets, and sheets, among other things.

loans.name: Tsogtbayar

texts.en: Mr. Tsogtbayar, age 50, lives with his wife and 2 children in a little house in Zavhan province. His wife is a seasonal worker and his 2 children own their private businesses. Mr. Tsogtbayar has been managing his own business of  trading organic dairy products since 2006. He buys various kinds of organic dairy products from the countryside at wholesale prices and sales them for retail. He has been shipping the organic dairy products from the countryside with his old car for many years. He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan for changing his car. He decided to buy a new car from Ulaanbaatar city. Mr. Tsogtbayar is an honest man.

loans.use: To buy a new car for shipping the organic dairy products from the countryside

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, shirts, and lingerie.

loans.name: Jose Matias

texts.es:
Jose, solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de chatarra: hierro, plásticos, aluminio, pues estos préstamo le permiten mantener la disponibilidad económica para salir en busca de comprar a los clientes, José además ha realizado la siembra de una pipianera, de este préstamo invertirá una parte para comprar abono y aplicarlo al cultivo.
Con el préstamo anterior mejoro su capacidad de compra a los clientes, pues esta es su dinámica, comprar a las personas comunes la chatarra y luego venderla a los mayoristas, con este préstamo ha mejorado la disponibilidad, tambien ha invertido en la nueva siembra y ha trabajado como ayudante de albañil, todo esto ha traído mejoras en sus condiciones familiares.
texts.en:
Jose is soliciting a new loan to be able to purchase recycled goods, like: iron, plastic, and aluminum.  The loan would help him stay afloat economically as he seeks out new clients to purchase from.  Jose also planted pumpkin patch and would apply part of the loan to purchase fertilizer for the plot.
With the previous loan he increased his ability to purchase from clients.  This is his job; purchase scrap from everyday people and sell it in bulk to a larger provider.  With this loan he has increased his purchasing power, has also invested in the new plot and has been working in connstruction as an extra hand; all of this has brought better conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase iron, pastic, aluminum, and fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia tiene 30 años, su pareja es José, con quien tiene un hijo de 8 años. Ellos viven en una casa rústica, pero propia, ubicada en una comunidad de la selva central. 
Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde los 20 años, pero intensificó su actividad cuando unió su vida a la de su pareja. Desde entonces, ambos producen plátanos, naranjas y otros frutos cítricos híbridos. Cuenta con cinco parcelas de terrenos donde se encuentran distribuidos sus cultivos. 
“Trabajar en el campo no es fácil, salgo en las mañanas y regreso tarde”, manifiesta. A pesar de ello, continúa en sus actividades con esmero. Una de sus dificultades fue la falta de capital, para el pago de personal, ya que ella y su esposo no se abastecen en todas sus parcelas. Pero con el tiempo y el apoyo económico ha logrado salir adelante y confía que sus metas podrán ser alcanzadas. Alicia desea una calidad de vida mejor, especialmente para su hijo, a quien piensa educar en colegios de la ciudad, por ello continuará trabajando. 

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por eso agradece por la confianza. Por su parte, menciona ser puntual y responsable con los pagos y con las actividades dentro de su banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer de Huacamayo”.
Alicia destinará estos 3000 nuevos soles en la compra de fertilizantes (con 2000 soles). Con lo restante comprará mamones de plátanos con los que iniciará otra plantación.
texts.en:
Alicia, 30, and her partner, Jose, have an 8-year son.  They live in the Selva Central.  Their house is little more than four walls and a roof, but it's paid for.
She has worked on farms for 20 years and she and her partner now make their living from farming. They grow platanos, oranges and other citrus fruits on five "parcelas" of land.  "Working the land isn't easy", she says, "I go to work early and come home late".  Even so, she keeps at it.  She tells us that one of their biggest challenges is raising the capital they need to pay laborers.  They have managed to get ahead anyway and Alicia is confident that they will reach their goals.  She wants her family and especially her son to have a better life.  

Alicia has received two MFP loans before and tells us that she is grateful for your help.  She is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.  She is a member of the Nuevo Amanecer de Huacamayo community bank.
Alicia will use part of this 3000 new soles loan to buy fertilizers (2000 new soles) and the rest to to buy other supplies she needs for her next crop of platanos.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Dieudonné

texts.fr: Dieudonné est un homme de 48ans,mariée, père de 06 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 6 mois et 13 ans. Cinq de ses enfants vont encore à l'école. il a ouvert et gère un bar  dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 2 ans déjà. Son activité fonctionne normalement grâce à son accueil chaleureux et son expérience qui lui ont permis de conquérir une clientèle importante.Mais cependant,la croissance considérable de sa clientèle ne lui permet guère de satisfaire à la demande de celle-ci,ceci dû à la petitesse de son capital d'où l'importance de ce crédit en moment pour son activité,car il l'aidera à augmenter le nombre de casiers de boissons ce qui lui permetrra non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle ,mais d'augmenter ses ventes et ses bénéfices. Il réinvestira une partie de ces bénéfices dans son activité et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en:
Dieudonné is 48 years old, married, and father of six children between the ages of 6 months and 13 years. Five of his children still go to school. He opened a bar in a neighborhood of the capital city two years ago and has been managing it for the past two years.

His buisness is going well thanks to his warm hospitality and experience that have enabled him to attract a large customer base. However, the significant growth of his customer base does not allow him to satisfy the demand of his customers, due to his small amount of capital. That is why he is currently seeking a loan for his business, because a loan will allow him to increase his stock of beverages, which will not only allow him to satisfy his customers, but also to increase his sales and profit.

He will reinvest a portion of his profit in his business and the rest will allow him to meet the daily needs of his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock of beverages (crates)

loans.name: Antonia Celia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 46 años, vive en la ciudad de Camana, la cual se caracteriza por el desarrollo de su agricultura, en especial por el cultivo de arroz, frejoles, maíz, entre otros; asimismo por la diversidad de su gastronomía en especial por uno de sus platos típicos, el cual es el riquísimo “chupe de Camarones”. Antonia es madre de un pequeño de 8 años y junto a su esposo trabajan muy dúo para der darle una vida digna y sobre todo con mucho amor ya que es el regalo más grande que Dios le ha dado y por el cual sale adelante cada día. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho pasear por el río que se encuentra en su ciudad y en ocasione sle gusta disfrutar junto a su familia de su palto favorito el cual es el Chupe de Camarones. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos él solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Con mucho entusiasmo Antonia trabaja como agricultora, ella ha sembrado pallares y por ello trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día ya que siempre está al tanto del cuidado del cultivo; ella cree que le va bien en su pequeño negocio porque ya tiene experiencia y sobre todo porque es muy cuidadosa.

Antonia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar abono y fertilizantes para su cultivo, con lo cual podra tener un cultivo libre de plagas y tener una buena cosecha, asi mejorara sus ingresos y poder seguir trabajando y luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Antonia is 46 years old and lives in the city of Camana, which is characterized by the development of its agriculture, especially its rice, bean, and corn crops, among others. It is also known for the diversity of its gastronomy, especially for one of the typical dishes, the very delicious "Chupe de Camarones" (shrimp soup). Antonia is the mother of an 8-year-old boy and together with her husband works very hard to give her son a dignified living and above all, a lot of love, since that is the greatest gift God has given her and the way she moves forward every day. When she has free time, she likes to walk by the river in her city and on occasion she enjoys her favorite dish, which is Chupe de Camarones, with her family. Given her limited economic resources, she could only study through the fifth level of secondary school, but she would have liked to get a university degree.

She works very enthusiastically as a farmer. She has planted butter beans and because of this she works around 10 hours a day since she is always on top of caring for the crop. She believes that things are going well for her in her small business because she already has experience and above all she is very careful.

Antonia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help that they have given her she will be able to buy compost and fertilizer for her crop, with which she will have a pest-free crop and have a good harvest. This way she will improve her income and be able to keep working and fighting to make her greatest dream a reality: to give her son a good education.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl is married with two kids. She is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. Cheryl is a farmer and she operates a banana farm to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years and every month she earns 3,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Cheryl became a member of GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Cheryl hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.es:
Elisabeth tiene 22 años, su pareja es Elvis, con quien tiene un hijo de 5 años. Ellos viven en la casa que construyeron hace poco con mucho esfuerzo.
A los 17 años tuvo a su hijo y desde entonces su vida cambio, empezó a dedicarse a la agricultura gracias a los terrenos que su pareja y ella obtuvieron de la comunidad. En esos terrenos produce café y achiote, exactamente son tres parcelas las que posee. “Este año recién empecé a cosechar café, por eso solo saqué ocho sacos, pero el próximo año cosecharé como 15, menciona. En cuanto al achiote, este año cosechó como 500 kilos, cada kilo lo ofrece de 5 a 7 soles, por eso le conviene cultivar ambos productos, porque su venta es inmediata. Ella quiere aumentar sus terrenos, porque es consciente que sus productos se venden bien, continuará trabajando para obtener sus propósitos.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y da su palabra de se puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Además dice que será activa y responsable dentro de su banco comunal “Flor de Almendra”.
Elisabeth destinará 2000 nuevos soles en la compra de bolsas de fertilizantes, lo restante será para comprar herramientas (machetes) y para pagar la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Elisaeth is 22 years old, her partner is named Elvis whom she has a 5 year old child with.  They live together in a house they recently built with grand effort.  She had her kid when she was 17 and since then her life has changed, she began working in agriculture thanks to some land they received from the community.  From these 3 plots of land they produce coffee and annatto.  " I just started to harvest coffee which is why I only produced 8 sacks, but next year I will produce 15." she states.  In regards to the annatto, this year she harvested 500 Kilograms and each Kilograms is sold for around 5-7 soles.  Because she is able to sell them immediately, it is beneficial to have both crops.  She would like to obtain more land, she is conscious that her products sell well and will continue to work in order to achieve her goals.

This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she gives her word to be punctual with her payments.  She goes even further to state that she will be an active and responsible member of her communal bank, " Flor de Almendra" (Almond Flower).  
Elisabeth will set aside 2000 nuevos soles towards the purchase of fertilizer, the rest will be utilized to purchase tools (machetes) and to pay for the cleansing of her crops.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer, machetes, and to pay off the cleansing of her crops.

loans.name: Sinuanua

texts.en:
Sinuanua is a 59-year-old married woman with seven children. She has a small plantation where she grows bananas and taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Sinuanua has requested a loan to improve her plantation with a grass sprayer and a knife. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Sinuanua hopes to add to her family income in order to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for a grass sprayer, a knife and school fees.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
“In every sacrifice there is a gift." This is what Rebecca believes. Every day, she is very optimistic that she can receive a gift through her business. 

Rebecca is 55 years old and married to Euligio. They live in the province of  Isabela, and they are blessed with two children: Albert and Janward.

Rebecca is a vendor in their village. She sells different merchandise in order to earn a living. Some of her products include vegetables, fish sauce, goto (congee), and halo-halo during summer in her little stall located near their house.

She would like to request a loan amount of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to be used as additional working capital for her business to buy different fruits and vegetables. She is always busy with her venture to earn a living. She wishes that somehow, someday, they can uplift their poor living conditions so that her children and future families will not suffer so much from life's difficulties.

loans.use: to buy different vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.en:
Mauricia is widow and is 57 years old. She is residing at Isidro Tan, Tangub City. Mauricia owns and operates a retail store to earn a living, and she's been five years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 4,700 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. In 2009, Mauricia joined GDMPC. In the future, Mauricia wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Faasuamalie

texts.en: Faasuamalie is a 63-year-old married woman with seven children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. With her profits, Faasuamalie hopes to save more and to improve her family income. Faasuamalie has requested a loan to help her with improvements to her plantation and her home. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to pay for fencing, bricks and paint

loans.name: Mario Felipe

texts.es:
Mario tiene 56 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ocoña, la cual se caracteriza por el desarrollo de su agricultura, en especial por el cultivo de arroz, frejoles, maíz, entre otros; asimismo por la diversidad de su gastronomía en especial por uno de sus platos típicos, el cual es el riquísimo “chupe de Camarones”. Mario es padre de 2 hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad y quienes han sido su mayor motivación para slir adelante al igual que su esposa quien es su mano derecha y sobre todo su mayor apoyo. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión y sobre todo programas de comedia, asimismo uno de sus platillos favoritos es el “Arroz Chaufa”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos el solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado terminar la escuela.
Día a día Mario trabaja como agricultor en su pequeña parcela , trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día ya que siempre está muy al pendiente de su cultivo y sobre todo porque le gusta mucho estar en el campo, el cree que le va bien en su pequeño negocio por sus ganas de salir adelante.

Mario está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abonos y fertilizantes para sui cultivo, de esta manera el podrá tener una buena cosecha ya que su cultivo estará libre de plagas y podrá mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando cada dia para hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener una mejor calidad de Vida y ser el mejor agricultor”.
texts.en:
Mario, 56, lives in the city of Ocoña which is characterized by agricultural development, especially rice, beans, corn and other things. It is also known for the diversity of its food, and in particular for one of its typical dishes, the delicious "chupe de camarones" [shrimp chowder]. Mario is a father of two grown children who have been his greatest motivation for getting ahead, along with his wife who is his right-hand woman and, above all, his greatest support. When he has free time he likes to watch television, especially comedy shows, and to eat one of his favorite dishes "arroz chaufa" [Peruvian fried rice]. Due to his limited economic resources he only went to some secondary courses, but he would have liked to finish school. 

Day to day Mario works as a farmer on his small piece of land. He works about 10 hours a day because he's always tending to his crop and above all because he likes to be in the field. He thinks his small business is going well because of his desire to get ahead.

Mario is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he will be able to buy compost and fertilizers for his crop so that he will have a good harvest and a crop free of pests, which will improve his income so that he can keep fighting every day to realize his greatest dream: "to have a better quality of life and be a better farmer."

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a 33-year-old widow who lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She only has one child to care for. She has been engaged in corn planting for five years to earn a living. She earns a monthly income of 3,200 PHP from this job. 

Rosalinda applied for a loan of 6,200 PHP at GDMPC to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She hopes to earn more income and apply for insurance for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Horacio

texts.es:
Horacio tiene 50 años, está casado con Josefina, con quien tiene dos hijos, pero ahora solo viven con uno de ellos. 
Él se dedica a la agricultura desde los 23 años y en todos estos años adquirió por medio de la comunidad y gracias a su trabajo, varios terrenos de cultivos, en total siete parcelas que se ubican en distintas partes. En ellas cultiva plátanos, naranjas y café; “tengo más cultivos de naranjas porque la zona es buena para esos frutos, por eso cosecho poco café”, menciona. 
La cosecha de naranja es cada cuatro meses, cada año, por eso tiene que atender bien a sus árboles para obtener buenos frutos durante este tiempo. La mayor parte de las cosechas de su comunidad es destinada hacia distintas ciudades del país, Horacio es consciente de ello y se esmera cada día.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer de Huacamayo”, grupo del que se siente a gusto por el trabajo en equipo.
Esta vez invertirá los 2000 soles en el pago de los jornaleros quienes limpiarán sus terrenos de la mala yerba que está infestada en sus cultivos de naranjas y plátanos.
texts.en:
Horacio, 50, and his wife, Josefina, have two children, only one of whom still lives at home.  
He has operated a farming business for 23 yars and now has seven 'parceles" of land.  He grows platanos, oranges and coffee.  "I grow more oranges than anything else", he says, "The land is well-suited to fruit farming, so I only plant a little coffee".  He harvests his orange crop every four months so he has to take good care of his trees in order to get the best results.  Most of the produce grown here goes to cities across the country.  

Horacio borrowed from MFP once before and is committed to repaying this loan in the agreed-upon time.  He is a member of the Nuevo Amanecer de Huacamayo community bank and says that he likes working with the other members.
Horacio will use this 2000 new soles loan to pay farm laborers to help him clear his land so that he can plant his next crop of oranges and platanos.

loans.use: to pay farm laborers.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 30 años, tiene un hijo de 7 años, a quien cuida mucho. Vive en la casa de sus padres en una comunidad nativa en la selva central del Perú.
La agricultura es su principal actividad, ha logrado educar y mantener a su hijo con las ganancias que ha obtenido de ella. No lo estaría logrando gracias a sus padres y su comunidad, quienes le otorgaron terrenos de cultivos para producir café, kión, cacao, yucas y plátanos. La falta de capital fue uno de sus principales inconvenientes, pero ahora, ya puede pagar a los jornaleros, quienes trabajan en la siembra, cultivo y fertilización de sus terrenos. Mientras estas personas trabajan, ella se encarga de preparar los alimentos y atenderlos, y luego también coopera con las labores agrícolas. Es una mujer que no se conforma fácilmente, pues está pendiente del mantenimiento de todos sus terrenos.

Es la primera vez que Vilma accede a un crédito con MFP, por ello da su palabra de pagar las cuotas a tiempo. Se siente a gusto trabajando con su banco comunal “Las Kioneras”, cuyas socias también son sus amigas.
Con el dinero de este préstamo podrá realizar la limpieza de sus cultivos de café, kión y plátanos, los que cada tres meses se pueblan de arbustos y mala yerba. Todo el dinero será para pagar a los jornaleros quienes trabajarán en ello.
texts.en:
Vilma is 30 years old and has a son who is seven years old for whom she cares a great deal. She lives in her parents' home in an indigenous community in the jungles of central Peru. Agriculture is her principal source of income, and she has managed to look after and educate her son with her earnings. None of this would be possible without the help of her parents and her community, who granted her land to produce coffee, ginger, cacao, yucca, and plantains. Lack of capital was one of her main hindrances, but now she can pay the day laborers who work to plant, cultivate, and fertilize her fields. While these people are working, she is in charge of meals and attending to their needs, and later she assists with the agricultural work. She is a woman not easily satisfied, being that the maintenance of all her fields hangs in the balance. 

This is the first time that Vilma will be receiving a loan from MFP, and she promises she will make timely payments. She takes great pride in working with her community bank "Las Kioneras," whose members are also her friends. The money from this loan will help her to clear the coffee, ginger, and plantain fields, which become overgrown with shrubs and weeds every three months. All of the money will go to paying the day laborers who will work the fields.

loans.use: to pay day laborers who will work to clear her farmland.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en: Melissa is a 26-year-old resident of Yahong, Tudela. Melissa helps her family from the little amount of 3,000 PHP she gains monthly from her cultivation of root crops, which she has been doing for 4 years. However in 2009 she became a member of GDMPC, and she applied for a loan at GDMPC micro finance of 3,300 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Melissa wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Clever

texts.es:
Clever tiene 22 años, vive con sus padres en una casa construida rústicamente en una comunidad nativa de la selva central.
Él inició sus actividades como agricultor desde un año. Sus padres le otorgaron una parcela de terrenos donde cultiva naranjas y plátanos. Este año cosechó una pequeña cantidad de naranjas, ya que una parte de la parcela está cultivada, mientras otra parte recién está plantada. “Al próximo año podré empezar a cosechar los plátanos y más naranjas, cada año las cosechas aumentan”, dice. Clever es un joven optimista y trabajador, confía que años más adelante su producción será mayor, como la de sus padres, y así construir su propia casa y formar su propia familia.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer de Huacamayo” y le agrada la idea de tener reuniones y actividades en grupo.
Clever invertirá estos 1000 nuevos soles en la compra de ocho bolsas de fertilizantes, cuyo precio es de 125 soles por bolsa.
texts.en:
Clever, 22, lives with his family in a roughly-built house in a rural town in the Selva Central.  
He started his farming business a year ago.  His parents gave him a bit of land where he grows oranges and platanos.  He only produced a small crop of oranges this year because part of his land had already been planted.  "I'll be able to harvest platanos and more oranges next year", he says, "and then increase my production in following years".  Clever is an optimistic, hard-working young man, confident that he can raise his production year after year, as his parents have done.  He wants to build a house and start a family of his own.

This will be his first MFP loan and he is committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.  He is a member of the Nuevo Amanecer de Huacamayo community bank and likes the idea of going to its meetings and joining its activities.
Clever will use this 1000 new soles loan to buy eight bags of fertilizers, each of which costs 125 soles.

loans.use: to buy eight bags of fertilier, each of which costs 125 soles.

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Juana Isabel  está casada, tiene 58 años de edad, cursó los 2 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la atención a molino de mixtamal, producción de chocolate y mermelada, inicio este negocio por iniciativa propia y hasta el momento lleva 22 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de insumos para la producción de chocolates, ya que espera tener un negocio prospero, y poder brindado una buena condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juana Isabel is married and is 58 years old. She studied 2 years, and has 5 children who are studying. She attend to the corn mill, and makes chocolate and marmalade. She started this business by her own initiative and to this day has 22 years of experience, with the support of her husband who who works in sales.  

She requests a loan which she will use to purchase the supplies for chocolate production, since she hopes to have a prosperous business, and to be able to offer a good condition of life to her family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make chocolate.

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es:
Jose, solicita un nuevo préstamo, pues considera que través de este aporte él mejora su capacidad en el trabajo, actualmente necesita invertir en la compra de fajas, discos, empaques y tanque para almacenar agua, y también pago de mano de obra ya que está mejorando las condiciones de local del molino, en esta ocasión también se montará un nuevo motor para trabajar con combustible, esto le ayudará para aquellos días donde se suspenda la energía eléctrica, y pueden continuar brindando su trabajo.

El préstamo anterior y ayudó a realizar la compra del motor para el molino y asimismo mejorar el servicio a los clientes, esto le ha permitido mantenerse en el trabajo y continuar con planes de superación.
texts.en:
Jose is asking for a new loan because he thinks that through this contribution he will improve his work capacity. Currently he needs to invest in the purchase of belts, discs, packaging and a tank to store water, as well as to pay laborers to improve the conditions of his mill. He will also mount a new gasoline motor that will help him on the days with the electricity goes out so that he can keep working.

The previous loan helped him to buy the motor for the mill and improve service to his customers. This has allowed him to continue his work and move forward with plans to improve.

loans.use: to buy belts, discs, packaging and a tank to store water.

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en: Mrs. Tungalag lives with her children in Govisumber, which is a province of Mongolia. Her younger daughter, G. Munkhtsetseg, is a college student, and her son is a secondary school student. Since 1999, Mrs. Tungalag has been managing her family business that sells solar energy equipment for herders. Now, she would like to expand her business to sell more types of goods, such as freezers and televisions, for herders. She needs 540,000 MNT to buy more solar energy equipment, freezers, and televisions. She is an honest person.

loans.use: To buy more solar energy equipment, freezers, and televisions

loans.name: Faasulu

texts.en: Faasulu is a 47-year-old woman who is married with 9 children. She runs a sewing business in her community. She has many years of experience with this business. Faasulu has requested a loan to improve her home and buy new equipment for her business. She plans to use her profits to help with her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to pay for fabric rolls, oil, an iron roof, timber, nails, cement and paint

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en: Ganchimeg lives with her husband and two children in a 'ger' in  the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She is 26 years old now and  started her business in 2006. Her mini-factory is producing wooden components and furniture for "ger" dwellings. She uses left-over wood to make her products. Her buyers are "Bogd-Urguu LLC", "Altan toonot urgoo LLC" and "Bat-Ulziit LLC" in the capital city of Mongolia. She has three experienced workers. Her husband also contributes to her business.  She is a hardworking woman. Now she is requesting 6,500,000 MNT to purchase construction materials for a new workplace and raw materials.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for a new workplace and raw materials

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla is a housewife and has four chidlren. To augment her spouse's income derived from the farming business, she is running a small store selling grocery items to the people in her village. She has been in her business for over five years now and usually earns about P3,000 each month from her business. It goes for their meals and allowances for her children.  She is asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy soft drinks, noodles and canned goods to sell. This will help increase sales capacity. She hopes to keep earning funds for the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, noodles and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es:
Lucas tiene 27 años, vive solo, pero tiene dos hijos a los que quiere mucho. Su casa es rústica, pero propia y se encuentra dentro de una comunidad nativa en la selva central.
Él es agricultor, cuando tuvo 22 años tuvo que hacerse cargo de su primer hijo, por ello empezó a trabajar la tierra con esfuerzo. Pero por diversos problemas se separó de su pareja. Ahora se hace cargo de dos parcelas de terrenos, en una de ellas plantó café, el que cosechará por primera vez el próximo año. En la otra parcela tiene plátano y naranjas. En las cosecha de estos dos productos le va bien; “este año el precio de la naranja estaba bajo, pero con el plátano las ganancias se alzaron”, menciona. Lucas espera alcanzar una producción considerable, de esa manera les otorgará a sus hijos una calidad de vida mejor; para ello tendrá que adquirir más terrenos de cultivos.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer de Huacamayo”, donde se siente a gusto porque muchos de sus conocidos están dentro del grupo.
Él invertirá este dinero en el pago de los jornaleros que contratará para la limpieza de sus cultivos de café y plátanos.
texts.en:
Lucas, 27, lives alone but has two children whom he loves a lot. His house in an indigenous community in the central jungle is rustic, but he owns it himself. When he was 22 he had to take charge of his first child and so began to work hard as a farmer. Due to various problems he had to separate from his partner. Now he has two parcels of land, one where he planted coffee which he will harvest for the first time next year. On the other parcel he has plantains and oranges, two products that sell well during harvest. "This year the price of oranges was low, but with the plantains the profits increased," he says. Lucas hopes to achieve a good production so that he can give his children a better quality of life, but to do this he will have to acquire more farm land. 

This is his first loan with MFP. He promises to make his monthly payments on time. He is part of the village bank "Nuevo Amanecer de Huacamayo" where he feels happy because he knows a lot of people in his group. He will invest the money in payment of temporary laborers who he will hire to clean the coffee and plantain crops.

loans.use: to contract day laborers to clean the coffee and plantain crops.

loans.name: William Jose

texts.es: William Jose  tiene 34 años de edad , casado con dos hijos menores de edad, el se desempeña como obrero, esta solicitando el financiamiento para realizar  mejoras en su vivienda ya que desde que la compro no había podido realizarlas por falta de capital , las mejoras consisten en levantar una pared perimetral, en la actualidad esto lo ha logrado gracia al apoyo que Fundación León 2000 y kiva le han brindado el financiamiento lo quiere para  comprar material de construcción como: bloques, arenas, cemento, clavos, alambre, tablas, hierro entre otro.
texts.en: William Jose, 34, is married with two young children. He is a laborer and is asking for a loan to make improvements to his house that he hasn't been able to make since he moved in due to lack of capital. The improvements include raising a perimeter wall, which he has been able to do thanks to the support of Fundacion Leon 2000 and Kiva who have given him the loan he wants to buy construction materials like cinder block, sand, cement, nails, wire, plants, iron and other things.

loans.use: to buy cinder block, sand, cement, nails, wire, plants, iron and other things.

loans.name: Thang

texts.en: Mrs. Thang is 51 years old. She has one child who is still in school. Thang is a teacher. She has been teaching for 20 years. She also raises cattle. Her total earnings from all her work are about 5,000,000 VND per month. Thang has been a member of the SEDA microfinance program since 2010. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,736,000 VND to invest in her livestock by buying food for her cattle and doing repairs on her small farm.

loans.use: to buy food for her cattle and do repairs on her farm.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge Luís, de 30 años de edad, soltero, tiene por actividad taxista, el financiamiento lo quiere para realizar mejoras de su casa las cuales consisten en levantar una tapia divisora, las cuales no había podido hacerlas por falta de recursos económicos, el financiamiento lo quiere para comprar material de construcción como: cemento, hierro, zinc, cal, arena, bloques, alambre, clavos entre otros.
texts.en: Jorge Luis, 30, is single.  He makes his living driving a taxi.  He is applying for a loan because he wants to make improvements to his house.  He wants to build a wall, he says, but hasn't had the money to pay for it.  He will use the loan to buy the construction materials he needs--cement, iron bar, roofing, sand, cement blocks, nails, etc.--to carry out the improvements.

loans.use: to buy supplies for house improvement project.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en: Gerardo is 53 years old and is married to Leticia. Aside from his farm production, Gerardo is engaged in his sari-sari store (variety store) in the village of Maligaya. He has been running his business for seven years. He wants to expand and re-stock his sari-sari store, but he lacks the necessary capital. In this regard, Gerardo is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 35,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, candies and daily use products to sell. Gerardo hopes to continue to access loans and achieve his dream for his children through patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, candies and daily use products to sell

loans.name: Aifai

texts.en: Aifai is a 39-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas. She has been doing this for many years. Aifai has requested a loan to buy new equipment and materials to improve her plantation. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Aifai hopes to save more money and supplement her family income.

loans.use: to pay for grass sprayer, a knife, weed spray and taro crops

loans.name: Sie

texts.en:
Sie is 39 years old. She is a single woman who has been residing in the Prey Chor district with her parents. She started a farming business to help her parents when she was a teenager. Because of financial difficulties, she just finished her studies at a secondary school level. From her farming business, Sie is able to generate an income of 6,500 KHR each day.

At the moment, Sie is very busy with her farm work, but she will not complete her work on time for the season without hiring laborers to assist in the maintenance of her rice fields. Due to insufficient capital, Sie is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 KHR to pay for labor costs and to purchase fertilizers for her crops. Through the help of the loan and her tireless work, Sie hopes that she can yield a better income than in previous years.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs and to purchase fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 27 years old and has two children. She got involved in an early marriage; that is why she did not finish her education and just cooks and sells snacks as a source of income. She would like to borrow a loan of P5,000 to buy more food products to sell. She will buy more fish balls and hot dogs to cook and sell.

Someday, with her small business, she hopes to increase her profits for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish balls and hot dogs to cook and sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is a store owner at Palao. She is married and has three children. She has been running her store for almost five years and earn P3,000 each month. She has three children attending school; that is why she aims to increase her income, too. She decided to take out a loan of P5,000 to buy noodles, sugar, coffee and canned goods to sell in her store. She hopes to keep increasing her sales capcity from the business and be able to save funds for education. She will be very happy and proud to see all her children become professionals in their chosen career someday.

loans.use: to buy noodles, sugar, coffee and canned goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 54 years old. She is a patient and business-oriented wife. She has seven children. Elvira runs a small store where she earns an income that provides for her family's needs. She has been doing this for more than three years now and earns just enough income to sustain her family. Elvira would like a loan to increase her product inventory. From her loan of PHP 13,000, she will buy canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, and noodles to sell in her store.

In the future, Elvira would like to save money as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, and noodles to sell in her store

loans.name: Turibio

texts.en:
Turibio is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. 

Turibio is providing motorcycle services. He has had this business for eight years. He requested a loan for 5,000 PHHP to buy new motor parts and for maintenance.

Turibio has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Turibio hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy new motor parts and for maintenance

loans.name: Jose Patricio

texts.es:
Jose, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos y crianza de ganado, el es una persona reconocida en la comunidad, actualmente vive con su esposa y siete hijos, se dedica a las actividades agrícolas, la siembra de maíz y también crianza de ganado, estas actividades las aprendió con su padre y por el momento las realiza con ayuda de sus hijos desde las cinco de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde, tienen experiencia de ocho años y trabaja en terrenos propios.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes e insecticidas, los cuales serán aplicados para prevenir las plagas en el cultivo, el riesgo que corre José con su siembra es la falta de lluvia ó otros cambios climáticos que afecten directamente la producción.
Su objetivo es trabajar por su familia y mejorar la producción en sus tierras, comercializar sus cosechas y generar un mejor ambiente en su familia.
texts.en:
Jose operates a farming and livestock business.  He lives with his wife and seven children and is well-regarded in the neighborhood.  He grows maize and raises cattle, work that he learned from his father.  He works, with help from his children, from 5:00 in the morning to 4:00 in the afternoon.  He has operated the business for eight years and owns his own land. 

Jose is applying for a loan that he will use to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his next crop.  The risk he runs, he says, is that there will be too little rain or some other problem with the weather that will affect his yields.  
His goal is to continue working for his family.  He wants to increase his production, sell his crop and create the best possible environment for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a 37-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, and bananas. She has been doing this for many years. Doris has requested a loan to buy equipment and materials for the business in addition to paying for her childrens education.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Doris hopes to expand her business to help improve living conditions for the whole family.

loans.use: to pay for chemicals, a knife, taro crops, a grass-sprayer and school fees

loans.name: Leiua

texts.en: Leiua is 42 years old and married with five children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as fizzy drinks, snacks and basic ingredients. She has been doing this for many years. Lieua needs a loan to buy more goods for her business. She hopes to use her profits to help increase her family income. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to pay for drinks, snacks, a cooler, flour, rice, sugar and sweets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of medicine.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a 30-year-old man married to Nelly and blessed with two children, ages six and two. Thomas sells flowers and other decoration items in his shop--a business he started seven years ago. He earns a monthly income of KES 6,000. 

Thomas has requested a first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase more flower stands and bunches of flowers to sell. The profit he makes will help him educate his children. 

He dreams of owning a piece of land and developing it as well as educating his children.

loans.use: to purchase flower stands and bunches of flowers to sell

loans.name: Asiasiga

texts.en: Asiasiga is 55 years old and married with seven children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as flour, sugar and cool drinks. She has been doing this for many years. Asiasiga needs a loan to borrow more goods for her store. She hopes to use her profits to improve her family's income. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to pay for drinks, snacks, coolers, flour, rice, sugar and sweets.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es: Jacinta de 45 años de edad, soltera con un hijo mayor de edad , es maestra de educacion primaria, esta solicitando financiamiento para realizar las mejoras de la vivienda que consisten en repello de la casa y cambio de techo de un dormitorio, mejoras que desde hace 2 años la quiero hacer por falta de dinero no se habian realizados, en la actualidad gracia al apoyo de fundacion y programa kiva le han brindado ha cumplido sus sueños y metas como es mejorar su casita poco a poco, con el financiamiento comprara material de construccion como: arena, cemento, bloques, zinc, clavos entre otros.
texts.en: Jacinta, 45, is single and has a grown son. She is a primary school teacher. She is asking for a loan to make improvements to her home including whitewashing the house and changing the roof on one bedroom, improvements that she has wanted to make for 2 years but hasn't had the money to realize. Now, thanks to the support of the foundation and Kiva, she has achieved her goals and dreams of improving her house little by little. With the loan she will buy construction materials like sand, cement, cinder block, tin roofing, nails and other things.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, cinder block, tin roofing, nails and other things.

loans.name: Saomalie

texts.en: Saomalie is a 42-year-old married woman with seven children. She operates a small plantation growing taro. She has been doing this for two years. Saomalie has requested a loan to buy equipment to maintain and harvest her plantation. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Saomalie hopes to keep improving her business.

loans.use: to pay for weed spray, a knife, taro crops and a plant sprayer.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil is 45 years old and lives in the Khoni district with his family. He has a wife and 2 children (13 and 16 years old). His children go to the local school. 

Avtandil and his wife earn their living through an agricultural business. Specifically, they have a large plot of land where maize is grown. Besides this business, Avtandil is successfully involved in an animal husbandry business. He has 4 milking cows, 6 calves and 2 horses. Avtandil’s wife milks the cows every day and produces cheese. The family sells cheese at the local open market. Avtandil and his wife also raise chickens. They sell hens in nearby villages. Year after year they repeat these activities because that's the way they have learned to earn a living.
 
Avtandil requested a loan to build a cattle shed. He plans to expand the dairy farm, but the existing cattle shed doesn’t allow him to implement this plan. After the cattle shed is built he will be able to double production and sales of cheese and the income of the family will significantly increase. All members of the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to build a cattle shed

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario tiene 40 años, su pareja es Raquel, con quien tiene dos hijos de 16 y 13 años. Esta familia vive en una casita sencilla, pero propia construida en una comunidad de la selva central.
Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 15 años, posee tres parcelas de terrenos donde cultiva café, achiote, naranjas y yucas, pero estos últimos son para su propio consumo. “El café y el achiote son más rentables, por eso me dedico más a su limpieza”, manifiesta. Este último año obtuvo como 1800 kilos de granos de café, que hacen como 30 sacos de 60 kilos. Una buena producción para el tamaño de sus parcelas. Además cosechó como 1500 kilos de achiote. Como sus cosechas las vende inmediatamente gracias a los contactos que consiguió durante tantos años de trabajo, ahora espera aumentar otra parcela, para ello continuará trabajando para comprarse otro terreno. 

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en pagar las cuotas con puntualidad. Por su parte manifiesta que le agrada el trabajo en su banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer de Huacamayo”, por la cooperación y las reuniones amenas con los socios.
El dinero de este préstamos lo invertirá en la limpieza de sus parcelas, en cada una invertirá como 800 soles, sólo para el pago de personal. Lo restante será para adquirir fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Mario is 40 years old and his partner is named Raquel whom he has 2 children of ages 16 and 13.  This family lives in a simple home they own, it's built in a community in the central jungle.  He has been working in agriculture for 15 years, he has 3 plots of land where he harvests; coffee, annatto, oranges and cassava, the last few are for his own consumption.  " The coffee and annatto are the most viable, which is why I spend more time cleaning those plots.", states Mario.  This past year he yielded 1800 Kilograms of coffee grain which fill about 30 sacks of 60 Kilograms each.  It is a good yield considering the size of his land.  He also harvested 1500 Kilograms of annatto.  He is able to sell his crops immediately thanks to the contacts he's made from many years in the industry.  He now wishes to have another plot of land, and to achieve it he will continue to work and purchase another plot.

This is his 3rd loan with MFP and he committs to paying on time.  He shares that he enjoys working with his communal bank, " Nuevo Amanecer de Huacamayo" ( New dawn of Huacamayo), due to their cooperation and the enjoyable meetings with members.
The money from this loan will be vested towards cleaning his land where he will spend around 800 soles for each on manual labor, the rest will be used to purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: to invest in the clearing of his plots, he would invest around 800 soles for each one to pay personnel, the rest would be utilized to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to put a better roof on his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 35 años, su pareja es Wilmer, con quien tiene cinco hijos. Ella y su familia viven en una casita rústica, pero propia.
Ella es una mujer luchadora, tuvo su primer hijo a los 16 años y la necesidad de cuidar y alimentar a su hijo la impulsó a trabajar arduamente en la agricultura. Al lado de su esposo, han cultivado en estos casi 10 años: café, kión, maíz, yucas y plátanos. Pero menciona que la yuca, la siembra raras veces y las cosechas le sirven mayormente para su consumo personal. Gracias a su comunidad nativa, cuenta con seis terrenos de cultivo, pero sólo produce en cuatro. “Tengo que limpiar y quitar los arbustos para empezar otras siembras”, menciona, y es una de sus metas. De todos sus productos, el café y el kión son los más rentables, por ello invierte más en ello.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y está agradecida por el apoyo que le brindaron anteriormente y ahora manifiesta que pagará con puntualidad las cuotas también. Pertenece al banco comunal “Las Kioneras” y se siente a gusto trabajando con mujeres emprendedoras.
Este dinero lo usará en el pago de los jornaleros para la limpieza de una parcela donde iniciará otra siembra de kiones, también comprará semilla.
texts.en:
Maria is 35 years old, and together with her spouse Wilmer she has five children. She and her family live in a small home, but one they own themselves. She is a strong woman. She had her first child at the age of 16, and the need to care and provide for her son led her to work arduously in farming. Along with her husband, she has cultivated for nearly 10 years the following: coffee, ginger, yucca, and plantains. But she notes that yucca she plants rarely and its harvests serves mostly for personal consumption. Thanks to her indigenous community, she has six plots of land, but currently only farms in four. "I have to clear away the brush to start other crops," she adds, and that is one of her goals. Of all her crops, coffee and ginger are the most profitable, therefore she invests more in them.

This is her second loan with MFP. She is grateful for the assistance given to her last time, and she promises that she will again make her payments punctually. She belongs to the community bank "Las Kioneras" and is proud to be working with enterprising women. This loan will be used to buy seeds and pay the laborers to clear the parcel where she will plant more ginger.

loans.use: to pay the laborers who will clear a parcel of land where she will plant ginger, and also to buy more seed.

loans.name: Apisa

texts.en:
Apisa is 50 years old. She is married and has three clever children. All of them are in university. Her elder daughter studies in a foreign country, while her two small daughters study in their native town.

Apisa's work in education requires much sacrifice and follow-through in teaching. Apisa works as teacher of foreign languages at a school teaching youngsters of various ages where she impacts knowledge with dignity. Her main concern is educating these people since they are future of the nation and improve standards of living. She has worked in this way for more than 33 years and has big experiences. Her salary from teaching is small and it is not enough to pay for daughter’s study at the university. She is asking for a loan of 4000 Tajikistani somoni (TJS). She will pay for her second daughter’s study at the university. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for study at the university.

loans.name: Sarwa Wiguna Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut succeeded in maintaining her pigs. Her husband supports her business because the results can help to improve the family’s income. She also succeeded in renovating the barn. 

Now she needs a new loan to purchase pig feed for her two sows. Her husband gave her money to support the business and to purchase an additional pig. She hopes the sow will give her healthy piglets and she can sell them to other breeders in her village.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en: Heng is 54 years old and lives in a rural area of the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She is a widowed mother of five children. She makes a living through rice farming on one hectare of farmland. Having been in this business for 29 years, she is able to earn approximately 20,000 KHR per day. She manages to save about 5,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. Her main challenge is the low crop yields caused by the drought. Heng’s group is composed of three members. Heng and one other member have been with Kiva partner VisionFund for four loan cycles, while the remaining member has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She has succeeded in improving her family’s livelihood and paying back all the past loans. Now Heng is leading her group to apply for a loan. She is going to use a portion of the loan to pay the harvesting fee for her dry season rice and a portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her rice planting during the rainy season. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her paddy field so as to set aside some money to purchase extra plots of farmland to expand her farming business.

loans.use: To pay harvesting fees and to buy seed and fertilizer

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: We Are Here Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “We Are Here” group from Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Mariama is the leader of this group. The 29-year-old is married to a driver and they have 3 children attending primary and secondary schools. Mariama has been a businesswoman for many years now, selling clothes (specifically Bamako clothes: prestigious clothes dyed in Mali). With her share of this loan, she will buy a bale of Bamako clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a bale of Bamako clothes to add to her current stock

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Rom is 52 and married. She has five children, including a son who is dependent on her and still in school. She and her husband struggle to feed their child through working for others for a fee to support the family. They have been in this business for ten years. 

Rom received her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, a cycle ago, while the other member is just a first-cycle client. Rom completely paid back the loan, which has helped her to support the child’s education. 

Now Rom and her group member are requesting a loan with VisionFund in amount of KHR 200,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to build a decent toilet. She hopes this toilet will promote good health for her family.

loans.use: to build a decent toilet.

loans.name: Suwarti

texts.en:
Suwarti works as an ordinary laborer; her income is uncertain. It depends on the time of planting and harvesting. Suwarti is confused because her son, Arif, needs money to finish school. Arif stayed out of school for one year while Suwarti had no other charges. Suwarti wants to apply for a loan through the student loan program of Kiva, to pay for Arif to finish school. In the picture, Suwarti appears with her son, Arif.

Arif will stay in school for one more year to complete vocational school. He hopes to finish and quickly find work as a computer technician in a company, in order to help his parents and younger siblings and repay the loan to Kiva.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Mukijah

texts.en:
Mukijah is the mother of Cornelia. Mukijah's job is uncertain, depending on the crops and the weather. During the rainy season, Mukijah cannot work and does not get money. Currently, Mukijah is in need of money for school fees for Cornelia. Cornelia has one more year in school, but Mukijah is worried about an uncertain financial condition. Mukijah is applying to Kiva for a loan through the student loan program to cover the cost of Cornelia's school this year. 

In the picture, Mukijah appears with her daughter, Cornelia.

Cornelia is currently in third grade at the vocational school, staying in school one more year to complete her studies. She hopes to complete the rest of the school year and quickly find work as a professional accountant in order to help ease the burden on her parents.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for the tailoring business.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang is a 28-year-old married woman who resides in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. Heang owns a few plots of farmland for cultivating seasonal crops such as rice, corn, and vegetables. She has been doing this alongside her spouse for ages, earning a decent income to support their living needs. 

For additional income, Heang and her spouse also work as a paid laborers on a rubber plantation and get their payment monthly. Their daily tasks are to collect rubber resin from each tree and bring it into a large container. 

This couple is responsible for three children, two of whom are attending a local primary school.

With the loan she has requested through HKL, Heang would like to invest in planting corn on her fields. She will purchase seeds and fertilizers, and pay for a tractor to till the land. It will enable her to keep earning income from her existing land and make her business more viable in the coming season. 

Someday, Heang hopes to attain a quality of life and provide all her children with better opportunities for education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers, and pay for a tractor to till the land.

loans.name: Tarsidik

texts.en:
Tarsidik works as a laborer. His income is very minimal, while he must pay for the six children, which he finds very difficult. Due to the lack of economic resources, three of the children are not in school. Currently, Tarsidik is looking for a way to pay for educational costs for Endang, who is spending one more year out of school. Tarsidik is trying to borrow funds through the student loan program of Kiva, to finance Endang's schooling to completion.

In the picture, Tarsidik appears with Endang, his daughter.

Endang is concerned about the condition of her family, and the expectations of her parents and siblings. Endang is trying to study hard to finish school quickly. Endang's ideal is to be a professional accountant. She wants to quickly get a job to help ease the burden of her parents.

loans.use: To pay for education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Susmini

texts.en:
Susmini is a mother who works as a laborer. Susmini is not young anymore; she has a fear related to the education expenses of their child, Daryati. Their income is only sufficient for the needs of everyday life. For one year longer, Daryati will attend vocational school, and this will continue to cost the family money. Susmini is applying for a loan through Kiva's student loan program for the cost of Daryati's schooling for a year. 

In the picture, Susmini appears with her daughter, Daryati.

Financial administration is Daryati's ideal. She is currently in her third year in the vocational school classes. In one more year, she finishes her schooling; she hopes to finish it because she knows her family is facing very difficult conditions. She wants to finish quickly and be able to help her parents.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is aged 37 and married with five children aged between thirteen and five years. He has twelve years in farming within his rural area in Western Kenya where he lives with the family. His farm produces maize, beans, vegetables, and milk for the local markets. Maize has been his main produce and helps him meet a major part of his family needs.

Timothy has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He hopes he will be able to generate enough income and establish a farm of seven dairy cows within five years. He says the diversification will help improve his farming income, which is usually challenged with seasonal fluctuation in maize prices. He adds that the income will help him a great deal in educating his children.

Timothy is, however, concerned with poor road networks, which make access to other markets expensive. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo’s loan services.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to his residence (plastering and painting among others).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Felipe is providing multi-cab services to transport different kinds of products. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to pay for the maintenance of the multi-cab.

Felipe has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Felipe hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the multi-cab.

loans.name: Kartiwen

texts.en:
Kartiwen works as a domestic servant. Her husband only works as a laborer. Kartiwen had four children. Two of them do not attend school because of economic limitations. Kartiwen hopes only for her first child, who currently sits in the third grade at the vocational school. Kartiwen is applying for a loan from Kiva to help with the school fees of Kaswan. 

In the picture, Kartiwen appears with her son, Kaswan.

Kaswan is the first child of four siblings. He is currently following the internship program of the school's field work program. In this, his last year of attending vocational school, he wants it over and wants to quickly find work as a computer technician in order to help his brothers.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Moey's Group

texts.en:
Aged 51 years old, Moey is a married mother of nine children living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang. To strive for this big household, she has been planting paddy rice, and her husband works as a construction worker in the local area. They have been in this business for 20 years,earning about 20,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day. 

Moey’s group consists of three members who are all females living in the same village. She is on her fifth loan cycle, while her two fellow group members are first loan cycle clients with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has completely repaid the past loans, which have enabled her to expand her business. 

Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Moey will use her portion to buy rice seeds for her paddy field and to buy construction materials in order to support her husband’s business. She hopes to earn more income so as to improve the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds for her agriculture business and to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 28-year-old woman living in Punjab, Pakistan, with her three daughters and a son. She is a very hard-working tailor who wants to expand her business. Sumaira and her husband's biggest aim in life is to give higher education to all of their children and to make each of them an independent human being in the future. But, because of financial constraints, it seems difficult for them to turn their dream into a reality. 

Sumaira has applied for a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan for purchasing a new sewing machine so she can stitch up more dresses and satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of this loan, that she will be able to expand her business and reach her desired net income. That would enable her to provide a quality education to her daughters and son and fulfill all of their basic needs in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a new tailoring machine.

loans.name: Sumarni

texts.en:
Living in barren and dry mountains, Sumarni does not have any special skills; she just works as a laborer. Income is uncertain, depending on the time of planting, harvest time, and the weather. Sumarni had five children. Only one of them, Niken, currently attends school. Sumarni would love to be able to finish the schooling of Niken, who only has one year to go. So, Sumarni is applying for a loan from Kiva to help Niken finish school. 

In the picture, Sumarni appears with her daughter, Niken.

Niken is a student at the vocational school. She is following the practice part of her schooling in the field. Niken wants to quickly finish school in order to help her parents. She also wants to quickly find work as a professional accountant, in order to help her brothers to continue their schooling.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy textiles for making wedding gowns

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ngadiyem

texts.en:
Ngadiyem lives in a village which is parched and barren. She works as an ordinary laborer. She has not enough income for her family's daily living expenses, so she finds it very difficult to pay for the additional cost of education for her three children. Ngadiyem wants all her children to go to school and finish--especially Solehudin, as at this time he enters his final year in vocational school. Ngadiyem is trying to participate in the student loan program of Kiva, so Solehudin can finish school. 

In the picture, Ngadiyem appears with Solehudin, her son.

Solehudin is the first child of Ngadiyem. He hopes to finish school and quickly find work as a computer technician in order to help ease the burden on his family and help his younger siblings to continue their education.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Rijem

texts.en:
Rijem is the mother of Rosihun. Rijem works as a laborer. Her husband has the same job, and her income is limited. Rijem has three children, two of whom are still in school. Currently, Rijem is in need of funds for Rosihun's schooling in the vocational school. Since this is the last year at the vocational school for Rosihun, Rijem is applying for a loan through Kiva's student loan program, to finance Rosihun to finish school. 

In the picture, Rijem appears with Rosihun, her son.

In his last year at this school, Rosihun really wants to utilize the time to learn more diligently. He wants to do this in order to obtain satisfactory results, so that his dream to become a computer technician comes true and so that he can help his parents to ease their burden.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Sarong's Group

texts.en:
Sarong is 25 years old and married. She lives with her husband and son in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a rice farmer who has worked four hectares of farmland for several years to make a living. The current business earns her about KHR 30,000 per day to meet her family’s needs. Low crop yields resulting from drought is the main challenge for her business. 

Sarong has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely repaid her first loan. She successfully used the previous loan to relieve her family’s burden and improve her livelihood. Her group consists of three female members seeking a new loan, and she is the group leader. One of her members is a third-time borrower while another one is a first-time borrower. As the leader, Sarong will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her crop yields in order to achieve her dream of buying a decent motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.en:
Nuriddin is 22 years old. He is young and full of energy. Five years ago he began a business with his father. They are builders and also master furniture craftsmen. Nuriddin and his father are said to have "golden hands" because the furniture they make is very wonderful. Their high-quality furniture attracts a lot of clients, so their business has developing year by year. 

Nuriddin intends to repair their home but he does not have enough money. This loan will help him buy building materials to repair their house. In this way he will provide high-quality living conditions for his family and put an end to their problems with the house.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as wood and cement for repairing his house

loans.name: Nabiya

texts.en:
A beautiful woman by the name Nabiya lives in a house that is in bad condition. Her husband is a kind man who works in Russia and has a very small salary. They have two clever children. Nabiya’s children want to live in the house that has good conditions, but her income from the sewing of national women’s dresses is not enough for it. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 somoni to build a new house because her family needs a big house. She wants to build a house with modern planning. 

In this way, she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. Each month, she will make her payment on time. She awaits your support and mercy. Please, help her and her family if it is possible.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as bricks and cement for building a new house.

loans.name: Daya Pertiwi Group

texts.en:
After successfully repaying the previous loan, Dewa Ayu and the Daya Pertiwi group decided to continue the loan, with each getting 2M IDR (Indonesian rupiahs). She has full support from her husband because it is considered beneficial to the family economy.

Dewa Ayu, who has two children, plans to use this loan to buy four piglets. She'll use her own capital to buy pig feed for six months.

Dewa Ayu is hoping to gain more profit than the previous loan, which only made a profit of 300,000 IDR per month. The loans are helpful to Dewa Ayu to develop the business and, of course, increase the family income.

loans.use: To buy four piglets.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora y carismática, la cual vive en la ciudad de Camaná, la cual se caracteriza por el desarrollo de su agricultura, en especial por el cultivo de arroz, frejoles, maíz, entre otros; asimismo por la diversidad de su gastronomía en especial por uno de sus platos típicos, el cual es el riquísimo “chupe de Camarones”, el cual es el platillo favorito de Rosa y quien lo disfruta junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, pero han sido el motor para que ella se esfuerce cada día para salir adelante y con quienes le gusta ver películas cuando dispone de un tiempito libre. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos Rosa solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho tener una carrera universitaria.

Con mucho entusiasmo Rosa trabaja como agricultora en su parcela, en la cual ha sembrado frejoles, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas ya que es muy cuidadosa y por ello ella cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y sobre todo por sus ganas de salir adelante.

Rosa está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar abonos y fertilizantes, además de poder pagar el agua para el regadío del cultivo, así de esta manera podrá tener un cultivo en buen estado y tener una buena cosecha, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y poder seguir adelante y  luchar para hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:2 Tener una mejor calidad de Vida”.
texts.en: Rosa is a very hardworking and charismatic woman. She lives in the city of Camaná, which is known for its agricultural development, especially for rice, bean, and corn cultivation, among other crops. It's also known for the diversity of its gastronomy, especially for one of its two traditional dishes, the delicious "chupe de camarones" [Peruvian shrimp chowder]. That dish is Rosa's favorite; she enjoys it together with her husband and five children, who are already adults. Her children have been the driving force behind her daily efforts to get ahead, and when she has a little free time, she likes to watch movies with them. Due to her scant economic resources, Rosa only studied through her fifth year of secondary school, but she would have liked very much to attend a university. With great enthusiasm, Rosa works as a farmer on her plot of land, where she has planted beans. She works around ten hours, as she is very thorough. She believes that it's going well for her because of her responsibility and above all her desire to get ahead. Rosa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders; thanks to the help they have offered, she will be able to buy soil amendments and fertilizers. In addition, she will be able to pay for the water to irrigate the crop. That way, she will be able to have a healthy crop and a good harvest, allowing her to improve her income and to continue moving forward and struggling to make her biggest dream—to have a better quality of life—a reality.

loans.use: to purchase soil amendments and fertilizers.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Juliet has a food/retail shop (or sari-sari store) that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 6,000 Philippines pesos to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Juliet has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Juliet hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for the sewing business.

loans.name: Rosario Zelmira

texts.es:
Rosario es una joven de 26 años de edad, ella vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se puede apreciar atractivos turísticos como la laguna de “Huacachina, la cual se ubica en medio de maravillosas dunas, en las cuales se practican deportes de aventura como el samboarding, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial se cultiva la uva, esparrago, pallares, frejoles, entre otros. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho hacer deporte, especialmente jugar vóley con sus amigas y vecinas de su barrio; asimismo le gusta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pollo”
Día a día Rosario trabaja como profesora en un colegio de educación primaria de su ciudad, ella enseña el curso de Computación; ella labora alrededor de 8 horas al día y con ello puede colaborar con los gastos de su hogar; ella cree que le va bien en su empleo porque tiene mucha paciencia con los niños y sobre todo porque es responsable y puntual.
