Salimah's group is composed of five hard-working women. Salimah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past two years, Salimah has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Salimah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more fresh food and some dry food for the restaurant for resale. The loan will help Salimah generate greater profits and take care of herself and her child. Salimah hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big restaurant. 

Salimah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock more fresh food and some dry food for the restaurant for resale,

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is from Lusot, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old, married and has five children. She has had a gardening business for three years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Lolita joined GDMPC. Lolita is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: to purchase manure and other fertilizer.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married and has two children, ages 10 and 3. She describes herself as faithful. She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located within a competitive business area and her primary customers are daily customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 8,700 loan to buy a water tank for her family use and her household chores. Her business goal is to expand her business and create job opportunities for people within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will build a big beauty salon in her hometown. Previously, Rose was involved in a grocery store business which yielded profits which she used to open a new retail store.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
This is Ivy.  She previously obtained an 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy new bikes to attach to pedicabs. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit.  

Profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ivy dreams of having more tricycles and hopes to have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is 24 years old.  He is married and lives in the Philippines.

Mario is providing "motorela," or motorcycle, services. He has had this business for four years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

Mario is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Zineta

texts.en:
Zineta is 44 years old and comes from the vulnerable ethnic minority community.  She is married and has four children, ranging from 11 to 18 years old, all of whom are in school. Zineta’s husband is employed as a construction worker.

Many people from these minority communities in Kosovo, such as Zineta and her family, live in extremely poor conditions.  They lack access to proper nutrition and care, as well as being exposed to unsanitary conditions. 

Despite that, Zineta sometimes works and sells handicrafts when she has an opportunity to.  The money that she and her husband generate is not enough to cover all of the daily living expenses.

Although raising four children and keeping food on the table is difficult at this time, Zineta remains optimistic.  She is always smiling. 

The toilet that they have is very old.  Zineta recently requested the loan to improve her family's living conditions by starting with renovating the toilet.

 She promises she will repay the loan on time.  She is very grateful to the KIVA lenders for improving her family’s conditions and contributing to her children’s overall health.

loans.use: To renovate her family's toilet

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
This is Elvie, 25, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Angelito, a driver operator, and has one child.  By the grace of God, she has managed to support her child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for everyday expenses.  

Elvie oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one motorized tricycle unit that carries up to four passengers to destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a daily quota each day to her.  In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Elvie dreams of having more tricycle units and hopes to give her family a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of their work.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Sorm

texts.en:
Sorm, aged 60, is a farmer living in Baray district with her family: her husband and some of her children. Sorm has five children who are currently married. Rice farming is her focused business and also the primary source of her family’s income. She cultivates and sells rice to local traders each harvest season, which occurs twice a year. Sorm has many years of experience in this project and her expertise allows her to generate good yields and income from year to year.

She is now asking for a loan in the amount of 600,000 KHR to purchase farm supplies such as chemical fertilizers and pesticides used on her farm. Sorm believes that she will be able to uplift her family's living conditions someday through her determination and tireless work. In years to come, she plans to save some of the profit to purchase extra land to increase the volume of her rice production.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as chemical fertilizers and pesticides used on her farm.

loans.name: Jovie

texts.en: Jovie is from the village of Maligaya. She is 40 years old. She is the mother of one child. To earn a living, Jovie is engaged in the hog-raising business. She has been in this business for three years and earns about PHP 7,000 per head every time she disposes of one. She wants to have more hogs to raise, but she has insufficient capital. In this regard, Jovie is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 13,000 to buy feed, vaccines and additional hogs to raise. She believes that through her patience and determination her business will grow further.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and additional hogs to raise

loans.name: Abad

texts.es:
Abad es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación pequeña, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Ciudadela Ferroviaria de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja por más de ocho horas como empleado en una empresa privada ya que debe ayudar con los pagos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para el pago de estudios de la universidad ya que estudia administración de empresas y con lo que gana no le alcanza para pagar sus estudios.
El sueño de Abad, es poder independizarse y ser encargado de una agencia en su trabajo y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida y sus ingresos.
Es la primera vez que solicita el crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Abad is single and has no children.  He lives in a small room in his parent's house.  The house is located in the Cuidadela Ferroviaria neighborhood of the city of La Paz.

Abad currently earns income because he works more than 8 hours a day as an employee in a private firm.  He does this so that he can help pay for food and for basic services for his family.

Abad needs a loan to pay his university fees, because he is studying business administration and his earnings are not sufficient to cover these educational expenses.

Abad's dream is to become independent and run an office, in this way improving his quality of life and income.  

This is the first time that Abad has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for his university studies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her nursing studies

loans.name: 74-Corazon De Maria Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 74-CORAZON DE MARIA Está  compuesto por once integrantes nueve  mujeres  y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  María  tiene 47 tiene dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de refrescos, actividad que realiza todos los días en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en una de las calles Más concurridas de la ciudad de Santa Cruz preparando y ofreciendo a su clientela variedad de refrescos,  La mencionada actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella y su familia la misma que  desarrolla conjuntamente con una empleada quien le ayuda a atender a sus clientes, el destino del crédito es para la compra por mayor de refrescos (gaseosas, jugos, cervezas y otros) para lograr tener una despensa llena,  la Sra. María es una persona muy trabajadora lleva años en esta actividad de la venta de comida está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo ya que en muchos casos mantienen solas a su familias.
texts.en:
The 74-Corazon de Maria entrepreneurial bank is formed of 11 members--nine women and two men. The bank's president is Mrs.María. She is 47 years old and has two school-aged children. She works selling a variety of soft drinks every day at her sales post that can be found on one of the busiest streets in the city of Santa Cruz. She prepares a variety of soft drinks to offer to her customers. This is the main source of income for her family. She has an employee who helps her attend to her customers.

The loan will be used to buy soft drinks in bulk (soda, juice, beer, and others) in order to be fully stocked. Mrs.Maria is a very hard-working person. She has worked selling food for several years. She is very thankful to the institution for the support provided to her and her partners in the group, since in many cases they are the only ones providing for their families.

loans.use: Buy soft drinks in bulk (soda, juice, beer, and others)

loans.name: Indhira

texts.es: La señorita Indhira, tiene 28 años de edad es de una familia humilde y de escasos recursos económicos pero la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora y por lo tanto se dedica a la venta de celulares y accesorios y tiene un puesto de venta en una feria sabatina de la ciudad del Cusco, ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento de Cusco, ella trabaja ofreciendo celulares y accesorios de segundo uso a diferentes personas que van a la feria. La socia Indhira es una persona muy respetada en su banco comunal “Minibank”. La socia Indhira está solicitando el presente crédito para comprar celulares y accesorios (audífonos, cargadores, envolturas, memorias y otras cosas más).
texts.en: Indhira, 28, is from a humble family with few financial resources, but she is an enterprising and hardworking woman.  She has a business selling cellular phones and accessories.  She has a sales post in a Saturday market in the city of Cusco.  She lives in the city and department of Cusco.  She works selling cellular phones and used accessories to various people who come to the market.  Indhira is well-respected in her communal bank "Minibank."  She is requesting this loan to buy cellular phones and accessories (headsets, chargers, covers, memory, and other accessories).

loans.use: to buy cellular phones and accessories

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic. She previously accessed a 19,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in the family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

Marivic would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better, as more items to sell will result in better profit. Marivic's profits from the business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marivic hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of giving her family a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other needed products

loans.name: Hava

texts.en:
Hava, 41 years old, is married and has two children, aged 8 and 10. Her husband works in construction. The city where Hava lives is more economically developed than other cities in Kosovo and is known for its handicrafts and trading. 

For the last several years, Hava has been making and selling handicraft items to earn her living. She operates her business from home and sells locally to customers in the area and also internationally, as she sends her wares to her sister in Switzerland, who sells them there. 

Business is going very well for Hava, due to the committed effort that she puts into her work. She has requested this loan in order to buy textile materials to continue making her items. Her goal is to improve her family's living conditions and to save money towards her children’s education. 

She is very thankful for the help!

loans.use: To buy textile materials

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 27-year-old single mother of one child, 10 years old. They are from Kisumu.

For the last five years, Ruth has operated a secondhand clothing sales business within Kisumu, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to increase her stock of secondhand clothes for sale. Ruth intends to save her profits for future use. Her dream is to open other business outlets.

loans.use: to increase her stock of secondhand clothes for sale

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida.  She previously obtained a loan of  PHP 10,000 that she used to purchase farm inputs needed to grow pineapple and bananas.  Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another PHP 15,000  loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and tools for her farm. 

Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Zenaida hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. 

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of their work.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for growing pineapple and bananas.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun is 48 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. She and her husband help each other to raise their family in a peaceful village of Kampong Chhnang province. 

They primarily plant and harvest rice both for sale and for their sustenance. Rice farming is the sole source of their income, which goes for food, commodity costs, and other expenditures. 

She has been doing this type of business for 22 years. She aims to become financially stable, so she and her family might experience a better life someday.

Due to financial constraints, Bun is asking for a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to buy fertilizers and to pay the labor costs incurred in transplanting rice. She believes that this loan will allow her to work out her plans towards achieving her goal.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay the labor costs in transplanting rice.

loans.name: Angelica Susana

texts.es: La señora Angelica, tiene 51 años de edad, es de una familia humilde y de escasos recursos económicos pero la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora y por lo tanto se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y tiene una tienda de abarrotes, ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento de Cusco, ella tiene un local en su domicilio donde ofrece sus productos a sus vecinos y amigos. La socia Angelica es una persona muy respetada en su banco comunal “Minibank”. La Angelica está solicitando el presente crédito para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, sacos de fideos, fideos y otros más.
texts.en: Mrs. Angelica is 51 years old and is from a humble family of limited economic means.  However, she is a very hard-working and motivated woman and for that reason she works selling basic food products and has a grocery store.  She lives in the city of Cusco in the State of Cusco.  She has a store in her home where she offers her products to her neighbors and friends.  Angelica is a very respected person in her communal bank "Minibank."  Angelica is asking for this loan in order to buy merchandise like for example bags of sugar, bags of pasta, noodles, and other items.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like for example bags of sugar, bags of pasta, noodles, and other items.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
This is Carmelita. She previously accessed a loan of 10,000 PHP that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan of 15,000 PHP to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Carmelita hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka, age 26, is married to a businessman. She has two children. She's a merchant and sells groceries in her store.

Mwaka gets her supplies in the neighboring municipal market. She wishes to satisfy her customers' every demand, and she lacks funds to get supplies. She's an active  client of Kiva's partner, Yehu, and she is seeking her first loan. With this loan, she will buy fruits and vegetables in order to reach her goal: satisfying her customers.

In the future, she would like to ensure her business is sustainable and enable her family to blossom. It should be noted that she's been in this field of business for 5 years. Mwaka plans to open a food stall in the future.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Hamdi

texts.en:
Hamdi is a married man who lives in the Roma community of Kosovo. In this community, it is traditional for people to play musical instruments at weddings. Hamdi has been doing this for more than 25 years and has been doing well. 

As it is currently the summer, there is much money to be earned. The summer is a popular time for people to get married, which generates much business for him and he is well paid. Hamdi is requesting a loan so that he can buy two musical instruments. 

The addition of these instruments will allow him to expand his repertoire and make even more money. His future goal is to expand his band and to open a training course for new musicians. Having this type of school will also provide him with an income in the winter time, which is typically slow due to the weather conditions and lack of people getting married or having celebrations.

Developing a way to provide an income for his family year round will provide much needed financial stability. He really appreciates this support!

loans.use: to buy two musical instruments.

loans.name: Alijon

texts.en:
Alijon is an industrious person who is married and has 6 children. He has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 5 years. Little by little, with the passing of time, he has perfected his knowledge. Thanks to the good condition of the animals, he has managed to win a large quantity of customers for his business. He sells his animals in the local market and has many customers.

Alijon is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. This way, he will be able to offer his customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing his household with good earnings. Each month he will make his payments on time. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy young cattle.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is a merchant from Bohol, Philippines. She has been running a sari-sari or convenience store for more than 20 years. This is her source of income.

Perlita is in need of additional capital for her business. She is applying for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional merchandise to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, snack foods, and other items. With this, she will be able to cater to more customers. Perlita dreams of improving her business in the future in order to generate more income and uplift her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, snack foods, and other items.

loans.name: Viergenie

texts.fr: Viergenie est une  femme de 40 ans mariée mère de 7 enfants dont dont l'age varie entre 7 et 27 ans, tous vont à l'école. Elle est commerçante dans le domaine de la restauration depuis 4 ans. Grâce à son accueil chaleureux et à la bonne qualité des plats proposés, elle a acquis une clientèle considérable et de plus en plus exigente.La petitesse de son chiffre d' affaires ne lui permet plus de satisfaire les doléances variées de la clientele. en effet,ce crédit lui permettra de diversifier et augmenter les quantités de ses denrées alimentaires entrant dans la composition de ses plats(farine, le riz et le haricot en gros).Avec sa marge benéficiaire, elle réinvestira dans son activité et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Viergenie is a 40-year old woman, married and the mother of seven children ranging from seven to 27 years of age. All of her children study. She has been selling cooked food for four years. Thanks to Veiergenie's friendly welcome and the high quality of her dishes, she has a considerable customer base that keeps growing.  Her small sales volume does not allow her to satisfy all of her customers’  requests. The present loan will allow her to diversify and increase her stock of food items needed for cooking   (flour, rice and beans, to be bought wholesale).  With  her profit margin, she will reinvest in her business and use the rest to help provide for family needs .

loans.use: to buy flour, rice and beans wholesale.

loans.name: Rimber

texts.es: El socio Rimber es una persona muy respetada en su banco comunal “Minibank” de la Asociacion Arariwa, él tiene 33 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo, el sigue teniendo una agencia de viajes en la ciudad del Cusco, su empresa tiene éxito, ya que hay muchos turistas que visitan la región del Cusco, él ofrece viajes a Machu Picchu y otros sitios de interés alrededor de Cusco, él está pidiendo un préstamo para comprar boletos turísticos. El socio Rimber disfruta mucho su trabajo y es muy trabajador y él se ha comprometido a hacer los pagos de los préstamos necesarios a tiempo.
texts.en: The communal bank member Rimber is a very respected person in his communal bank "Minibank" of the Arariwa Association. He is 33 years old. He is married and has a son. He continues to have a travel agency in the city of Cusco. His business is successful, since there are many tourists who visit the Cusco region. He offers trips to Machu Picchu and other sites of interest around Cusco. He is applying for a loan to buy tourist tickets. Rimber enjoys his work a lot and is very hard-working, and he has promised to make the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tourist tickets.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
This is Jennifer. She previously accessed a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jennifer hopes to be able to expand her business soon, just as she hopes to draw her family to God. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy used clothes for the thread-making business.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda is 25 years of age and lives with her single daughter in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water.

Roda owns a store selling khangas (traditional African cloth) to the general public. She noticed that her business has been slowly growing, and demand for products is getting stronger. Now that her customers feel satisfied with her services, they are requesting a wider range of khangas.

At the moment, Roda is seeking a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase bales of khangas to satisfy customer demand. With this loan, she hopes to better herself economically and pay for her daughter's education since she is single. She also notes that thanks to these types of credit organizations, she is able to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas (traditional African cloth).

loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
Mey is an operator of a transportation business in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. He devotes his full-day time outdoors to offer his service except his lunch time. He does his work honestly because he wants to better his living conditions and provide a good education for his two children who are attending school. He has been engaged in this for more than five years. Mey is now 34 years old and married to a local farmer. During the rainy season, Mey usually helps his wife in managing the maintenance of the rice field to ensure a high production each harvest season.

Mey has applied for a loan through HKL, a partner of Kiva, to purchase seeds and fertilizer to sow in his ground. Mey mentioned that without this loan, he will not be able to make his business possible. He is very happy and thankful for the generosity of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer to sow in his ground.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials such as Eva rubber, card stock, and some tools to make her party decorations

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes for a clothes-selling business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and only two of her children go to school. She also takes care of two additional family members (sister and brother). She operates a beauty salon from home. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy braids, weaves, treatments, and oils. Her major business challenges are transportation, defaulters, and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked salon and also to educate her children up to university level. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major expenses include paying for utility bills and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more braids, weaves, treatments, and oils for her salon

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es: Jose de 57 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su esposa y sus 5 hijos en las edades de 3 a 15 años; allí se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada; él  diariamente y desde muy temprano sale por la calles de la ciudad, vendiendo trapeadores, escobas, baldes, ollas y electrodomésticos menores en general. Su experiencia en este negocio data desde su adolescencia, en las calles de Cartago, un municipio del departamento del Valle del Cauca, donde acompañaba a su padre a hacer las compras  de artículos para venderlos calle a calle en Cali, una ciudad hermosa, donde la música salsa se respira en cada rincón de ella.  Cuando José tuvo edad para hacerlo y ya trasladado a Cartagena, empezó el mismo negocio allí, con el fin de genera ingresos que le permitieran el sostenimiento de su hogar. Su sueño es tener un local propio donde establecer su negocio y no deambular por as calles con toda la mercancía para lograr venderla, ante el inclemente sol caribe de esta ciudad de playa brisa y mar. Su mayor desafío es lograr capitalizar su negocio y establecerse en un punto estratégico para aumentar sus ventas. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer  financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará artículos domésticos, electrodomésticos menores que tiene encargados por sus clientes en la etapa de preventa. José trabaja persistentemente porque como buen padre de familia, sueña con ver convertidos a sus hijos en personas exitosas y con construirles un futuro prometedor poniendo de si mismo todo sus esfuerzos para lograrlo con su trabajo.
texts.en: 57-year-old Jose lives in the city of Cartagena with his wife and five children aged 3 to 15. There, he sells a variety of merchandise. Early everyday he goes out on the streets of the city, selling mops, brooms, buckets, pots and general small electrical appliances. His experience in this business goes back to his adolescence, in the streets of Cartago, a municipality in the department of Valle del Cauca, where he would accompany his father to buy the items to sell street by street in Cali, a beautiful city where salsa music is breathed in every corner of the city. When Jose was old enough to do it, and moved to Cartagena, he started the same business there, with the aim of generating income that would permit him to support his family. His dream is to have his own local where he could set up his business and not wander the streets with all of his merchandise in order to manage to sell it, under the harsh Caribbean sun of this breezy beach town. His biggest goal is to achieve the capitalization of his business and to set up his store in a strategic spot to increase his sales. This is the reason why he is turning to a Kiva loan, the first funding that he will get from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which he will buy household items and small electrical appliances that his customers have pre-ordered. Jose persistently works because, as a good farther, he dreams of seeing his kids turn into successful people and of building a promising future for them. Therefore, he puts all of his efforts into achieving this through his work.

loans.use: to buy household items and small electrical aplliances.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and two of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells second hand clothes at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 3 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes.  Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to build rental houses and to become a wholesaler. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, electricity, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Julia Sonia

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive al lado de su pareja quien la apoya en todo lo que ella emprende ya que es u brazo derecho; su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de Parcona, Ica, Perú. El distrito de Parcona se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y sobre todo por la generosidad de sus pobladores. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre a Julia le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones le gusta preparar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la riquísima “Carapulcra con sopa seca”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos julia sol pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser chef.

Día a día Julia trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes al día, su pareja la apoya con la atención de los clientes cuando Julia está preparando los platillos y por ello Julia cree que le va bien en su negocio porque atiende bien a sus clientes y sobre todo tiene muy buena sazón.

Julia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mesas, sillas, pintar el local, comprar insumos para la preparación de los alimentos, entre otros, así de esta manera ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener un gran restaurante”.
texts.en:
Julia is a hard-working woman. She lives with her partner, who supports her in everything she undertakes, since he is her right arm. Her house is located in the Parcona district in Ica, Peru. The Parcona district is characterized by having a warm climate and above all for the generosity of its people. When she has some free time, Julia likes to watch television, and on some occasions she likes to prepare one of her favorite dishes, which is the very delicious "carapulcra con sopa seca" ("carapulcra with dry soup," a Peruvian dish made from meat, freeze-dried potatoes, pasta, vegetables, and seasonings). Because of her few economic resources, Julia was only able to go to school through the fifth year of secondary education, but she would have liked to study to be a chef.

Day after day Julia works in her little business where she sells food. She works about 8 hours a day and can serve up to 30 customers a day. Her partner supports her by waiting on customers when Julia is preparing the meals, and for this reason Julia feels that it is going well for her in her business because she tends to her customers well and above all her food tastes very good.

Julia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help that they have offered her she will be able to buy tables and chairs, paint her premises, and buy ingredients to prepare her food, among other things.  Thus in this way she will be able to improve her income and her quality of life and continue striving to make a reality of her greatest dream: to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy garments for her husband's garments selling business

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
This is Sharon. She previously accessed a 19,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Sharon hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.en:
Bashorat is married to a kind man by the name of Turdiboy. They have three children. Their names are Farhod, Sarvinoz and Farruh. She always wanted to provide them with good education, and since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Bashorat decided to start a new business with sewing in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances.  

If you will help her with money she will buy a sewing machine and fabrics. She studied a ‘To get success’ course from a women's organization and got enough skills about business. She will be a very successful business woman, as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of TJS 5,000 to organize the new business. She will get through using the loan and make her business a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabrics to organize the new business.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
This is Ligaya. She previously accessed an 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her rug-making business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Ligaya hopes to increase production and dreams of being able to give her family a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Moussiliatou's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux membres en caution solidaire. Moussiliatou, la responsable, âgée de 31 ans, est mariée et mère de trois dont un est scolarisé. L'aîné a 05 ans et les deux jumeaux ont 02 ans. Elle a une boutique où elle vend des mèches, des produits de beauté et des foulards depuis trois ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur. En vue de renforcer son fonds de roulement et de répondre favorablement à la demande de sa clientèle, elle a fait recours au financement de Finadev. Ce financement lui permettra de maximiser son profit et de contribuer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Moussiliatou se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This is a group comprised of two members who are mutual guarantors. Moussiliatou is in charge of the group. She is 31, is married, and has three children - one of whom goes to school. The eldest is 5 and the twins are 2 years old. 

For three years, she's had a boutique where she sells hair extensions, beauty products, and scarves. She buys her supplies in a market in Benin and from outside the country.

In order to reinforce her working capital and to respond to client demands, she is asking for the financial help of Finadev. This funding will allow her to maximize her profit and to contribute to her children's schooling. 

Moussiliatou is pictured at left.

loans.use: to buy 2 boxes of hair extensions, 2 boxes of hair products, and 3 dozen scarves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy candy and groceries.

loans.name: Reyna   Maria

texts.es: Reyna  María,  de  35 años de edad, casado con cuatro hijos todos menores de edad, los cuales están bajo su responsabilidad, tiene por actividad económica venta de mercadería en general, desde hace 8 años, el negocio lo tiene ubicado de forma ambulante y en su casa, dicha actividad la aprendió desde muy joven ayudándole a vender a mi madre, el financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo como: pantalones, blusas, short, bolsos, camisetas, playeras, cosméticos, zapatos pijamas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Reyna  María is 35 years of age and married with four children, who are all minors and under her care. She has been working for 8 years selling general merchandise. She conducts her business partly from her house and partly in a mobile manner from place to place. She learnt about this type of work from a very young age, helping her mother with sales. 

She is asking for the loan to buy to buy items such as pants, blouses, shorts, bags, t-shirts, tennis shoes, cosmetics and slippers.

loans.use: to buy items such as pants, blouses, shorts, bags, t-shirts, tennis shoes, cosmetics and slippers.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Cesar le esta haciendo falta un techo al frente, pues tiene una lona provisional la cual ya esta muy deteriorada, por las inclemencias del clima. Quiere poner un techo de madera, porque es más barato y podrá el realizar la mejora. 
Don Cesar vive solo ya que es divorciado y sus hijos ya son personas mayores. Trabaja como guardia de seguridad de una compañía.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar el material necesario. Desea mejorar su vivienda y que tengo una mejor comodidad  y protegerse del clima.
texts.en: Cesar's house lacks a roof at the front part. It has a temporary tarpaulin which has deteriorated due to the weather. He wants to construct a wooden roof, because it is cheaper and he could do the work himself. Cesar lives alone since he is divorced and his children are now adults. He works as a security guard for a company. He is asking for the loan to buy the necessary materials. He wants to improve his home, to make it more comfortable and to protect himself against the weather.

loans.use: to construct a wooden roof at the front of his house.

loans.name: Benita Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Benita Gregoria esta casada, tiene 66 años de edad, cursó la educacion primaria, tiene 3 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando todavía, se dedica al comercio, a la venta de de ropa de toda clase, inicio este negocio por necesidad de apoyar a su familia y hasta  el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de mas mercadería: Suéteres, blusas, playeras, ropa para bebe, ropa intima, toallas, edredones, cubrecamas, mochilas, etc. Espera en el futuro contar con un local para su venta.
texts.en: Benita Gregoria is married and 66 years old. She finished her primary school education. She has three children of whom one is still studying. She works in retail, selling all types of clothing. She started this business because she needed to support her family and she now has 10 years experience. She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise: sweaters, blouses, t-shirts, baby clothes, underwear, towels, eiderdown, bedspreads, backpacks etc. In the future she hopes to have a shop from which to make her sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Silvia Laura

texts.es:
La señorita Silvia Laura es soltera y vive con sus padres que son ya personas mayores de edad. 
Esta solicitando un crédito para la colocación de la losa en los cuartos en la planta alta de la vivienda, ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejorar, así terminar los cuartos que serán para que ella viva, sin descuidar y atender a sus padres.
Desea mejorar la calidad de vida y tener su propio espacio en la casa.
Silvia Laura tiene ya más de 30 años trabajando en una maquiladora, en el aria de producción.
texts.en:
Silvia Laura is single and lives with her elder parents. 

She is requesting a loan to construct a slab in the top floor of her house because she does not have the money needed for the improvement of the house, as well complete the rooms that will she will use to live, without neglecting her parents. 

She wants to improve her quality of life and have her own space in the house. 

Silvia Laura has already more than 30 years working in an assembly plant, in the production area.

loans.use: to construct a slab in the top floor of her house

loans.name: Sandy Diana

texts.es:
Sandy es una mujer de 26 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su Padre y sus 2 hermanos, lamentablemente cuando era pequeña sufrió la pérdida de su Madre; ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus Padre, Sandy se encuentra estudiando la carrera técnica de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un delicioso Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia. 
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Sandy trabaja como Empleada del Hogar, brindando se servicios de limpieza en diversos hogares donde la contratan, todas las mañanas ella inicia su labor donde trabaja un aproximado de 8 horas diarias, ella cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás. 
Sandy se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir sus gastos de estudios, tales como pago de matrícula, libros, folletería y útiles de escritorio; de esta manera Sandy contará con los implementos necesarios para seguir cursando sus estudios superiores, así ella espera convertirse en una gran Profesional y en una mujer de bien.
texts.en:
Sandy is a single 26 year-old woman.  She lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Santiago, along with her father and her two siblings.  Sadly when she was a child she suffered the loss of her mother.  She is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person who has a great desire for success.  Thanks to her efforts and the support of her father, Sandy finds herself studying for a career in Business Administration.  In her free time she likes to relax and watch movies, and on some occasions cook a delicious Arroz con Pato (Rice with Duck) to share with her family.  

With great energy and enthusiasm, day to day Sandy works as a House Cleaner, offering cleaning services in diverse homes where she has been contracted.  Every morning she begins her labor and works approximately 8 hours daily.  She believes that things are going well because of her efforts and due to the kind treatment that she offers to others.

Sandy is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help offered she will be able to cover the expenses for her studies, like the payment of tuition, books, handouts and writing supplies.  In this way Sandy will be able to count on the necessary implements to be able to continue pursuing her advanced studies.  She hopes to become a great professional and an accomplished woman.

loans.use: to cover expenses related to her studies.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: Alba Luz de 41 años de edad, con 4 hijos menores de edad, ella tiene por actividad económica la producción y venta de reposterías, tiempo de tener el negocio 12 años, el negocio consisten en la producción de todo tipo de repostería como: cosa de horno, empanadas, enrolladlos, cachos, sopa de leche, tortas de piñas, maletas, queques entre otros. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación, en la actualidad está solicitando el financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo ya que su demanda se ha incrementad Y Aprovechara el financiamiento para la compra de productos como: harina,manteguilla, canela, aceite,leche, queso,huevos entre otros.
texts.en: Alba Luz is 41 years old and has four minor children.  She works producing and selling baked goods and has been working in the business for 12 years.  The business consists of making all types of baked goods such as assorted pastries, empanadas, wraps, cannoli, rice pudding, pineapple cakes, layered cakes, and sponge cakes, among other items.  The business is located in her home.  Currently she is asking for a loan in order to invest in food products since demand has increased.  She will use the loan to purchase products like flour, butter, cinnamon, oil, milk, cheese, and eggs.

loans.use: to purchase baking products like flour, butter, cinnamon, oil, milk, cheese, and eggs.

loans.name: Om-Hasan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om-Hasan and consists of five women who live in Sana`a, Yemen.

Halima is 30 years old and lives in Sana`a with her family. She is a married housewife and has two children, who attend public school. She is hard-working and knows well how to manage her children's care. She has applied for a youth loan of 50,000 Yemeni rial (YER) from AMB to buy a washing machine for her house.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine for her house.

loans.name: Bajram

texts.en:
Bajram is living in the south western part of Kosovo in a Roma Community. Bajram has been a self employed musician for many years who performs for weddings and other celebrations in his area. He usually works exclusively in the summer and spring as weather conditions prevent weddings, celebrations and other events from being held during the winter. This results in Bajram having to budget his income to cover those months when he is not working as he has no other source of income.

Bajram has had a longstanding problem with his toilet because it has not been repaired in the past several years. He is requesting a loan to renovate his toilet, which is in urgent need of repair and is unsanitary and unhealthy in its current condition. 

He is very grateful for this opportunity to improve his living conditions and he appreciates all lenders!

loans.use: To renovate his toilet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise needed in her business

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 29 years old and is married to Emily. They don't have any children. Benard is from Kisumu county and, for the past seven years, he has sold second-hand clothing in  one of the city markets.

Benard is requesting his first 10,000 KES loan from KADET LTD to buy a stock of second hand clothing to sell. He intends to use profits add more clothes to his business. His dream is to open other business outlets.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Nhoek

texts.en:
Nhoek is 27 years old and a married woman who has a school-aged kid. She happily lives with her husband, her mother, her child, and a nephew, in thatched house in Baray district. Nhoek works as a farmer and cultivates a few lots of land to grow rice. She is also pursuing a business from a rented booth to provide extra income. Nhoek sells skewers of grilled beef and sausages with pickle and earns approximately 4 USD daily. Her husband operates a transportation business and earns around 4.80 USD per day. 

Nhoek is requesting a 1,500 USD loan to purchase a new motorcycle for her husband's business. His old motorcycle always has mechanical problems that make it difficult for Nhoek’s husband to provide services to his customers. Nhoek and her husband hope that they can sustain their businesses and yield better profits to improve the overall welfare of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle for her husband's transportation business

loans.name: Hona

texts.en:
Hona is a 38-year-old married woman living in the Ashkai community. She is a housewife caring for her six children who range in age from seven to 13 years old. Hona's husband works at a private company that manufactures tiles and other materials for toilets. His salary is very low and is not enough to cover the family's daily expenses and much-needed home renovations. 

The family's house is extremely old and in poor condition, which exposes the family to unsanitary and unhealthy living conditions. Hona is requesting a loan to buy materials for the renovation of her home to ensure healthier and improved living conditions for her family. Hona is grateful to KosInvest- Kiva lenders for helping to improve her family's conditions and standard of living!

loans.use: to buy home renovation materials

loans.name: Zemirah

texts.en:
Zemirah is a 22-year-old married woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has two young children ages two and four years old. For the past four years, Zemirah and her husband have been in the fishing business.

Zemirah is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy new fishing nets, flashlights, and other fishing materials for her business. She believes that through her loan, she and her husband can enhance their catch and increase their sales and income. In the future, Zemirah dreams of improving her business so that it will generate more income. Moreover, she wants to save for the future schooling of her young children.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, flashlights and other materials

loans.name: Tomasa Yamilet

texts.es: Tomasa Yamilet de 32 años, soltera con dos hijos menores de edad, tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa nueva desde hace 13 años que se dedica a dicha actividad, el negocio lo inicio vendiendo de forma ambulante, en la actualidad ha podido con los ingresos del mismo tener una tienda en un lugar fijo, con el financiamiento comprara mercadería para invertir en el negocio como: pantalones, camisas, short, camisetas, faldas entre otros. Gracias al apoyo que Fundación 2000 y el programa kiva le brinda es que ha podido mantener y hacer crecer su negocio generándole buenas ganancias para poder mantener a mis hijos y de dicha forma cumplir con metas y objetivos a largo plazo personales como ver realizados a sus hijos como profesionales.
texts.en:
Tomasa Yamilet is 32 years old and is single with 2 young children. She works selling new clothing. She has done this for 13 years. She started the business as a street vender, but nowadays with the profits of the same, she has been able to have a store in a fixed location. With the loan she will purchase merchandise to invest in the business such as pants, shirts, shorts, t-shirts, and skirts, among others. 

Thanks to the support that Fundación 2000 and the Kiva program offer her, she has been able to maintain and make her business grow. She is generating good profits to be able to support her children and in the same way, form long-term personal goals and objectives, such as to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, shorts, t-shirts, and skirts, among others.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is a married man who describes himself as determined and focused. For two years, he has been operating a retail business where he sells eggs. His business is located in an environment with good business potential and his primary customers are schools, children and teachers. He describes his biggest business challenge as the lack of a quick and cheap means of delivering eggs to customers. 

He will use the 8,700 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy a water tank for his family. His business goal is to run many similar retail businesses within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for his family

loans.name: Gulo

texts.en:
Gulo is 50 years old. She lives in Akhmeta District with her husband, Eldar, her mother-in-law, her 27-year-old son, David, her daughter-in-law and two little grandchildren. Eldar is unemployed. Her son is a construction worker and gets a service fee for the work and her mother-in-law is a pensioner. 

Gulo requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for agricultural business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is the monthly salary of David and the pension of the mother-in-law. The average monthly income of the family is 250 Laris. It is hardly enough for food for a seven-member family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Gulo requested a loan from Credo to start livestock farming. Her loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Gulo will purchase calves. She will grow them and sell them after several months. Grown calves will be sold for a good price, bringing additional income to the family. For the next cycle, Gulo will purchase more calves. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Their income will double and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Sur

texts.en:
Sur is a conscientious farmer who primarily grows and harvests rice and potatoes on her inherited farmland, located in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. Sur and her husband aimed to improve their farming business in order to yield a better profit, from which they will be able to support their children’s higher education. Sur is 41 years old and a mother of two children: the oldest one is preparing to attend college this year; and the younger one is a student at high school.

With the amount she has requested, Sur will pay for her child’s tuition fees. Also, with the balance of the loan, she will purchase seeds and hire a few laborers to prepare the land for growing rice. Sur surely believes that this loan will help provide an opportunity for her child to attend a college in Phnom Penh as well as to make progress in her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for her child’s tuition fees and to purchase seeds and hire a few laborers to prepare the land for growing rice.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is a 58-year-old married woman from Bohol, Philippines. 

She has run a sari-sari store or convenience store for more than 30 years now. She sells snack foods, candies, cooking ingredients, soda and other items.
 
Aurora works hard to provide support for her family. As of this time, she is in need of additional capital for her business. Aurora is asking for a loan worth 10,000 PHP to buy additional merchandise to sell such as canned goods, noodles, snack foods, soda and other items. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more customers in her place.

Aurora hopes to make her business a success. She believes that if she will be provided with financial support through loan, there's a way to make it possible.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell such as canned goods, noodles, snack foods and soda.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa is a 56-year-old married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She has three grown children. 

Tomasa is in the retailing business, selling herbal medicine to the people in their community. This is the source of her income.

Tomasa is in need of additional capital for the business. She is requesting a loan worth 4,000 PHP to buy additional stocks to sell such as herbal medicines and others. With this, she will be able to sell more stocks to her customers and friends.
 
Tomasa dreams of expanding her business and making it sustainable to generate more revenue necessary for their expenses and needs.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell such as herbal medicine and others.

loans.name: Chuluunbaatar

texts.en:
Chuluunbaatar, 30, is a driver and he has worked as a driver in the petrol company since 2010. His wife works as an assistant teacher in the college. He lives with his family in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

His two children always got sick in winter due to the cold at home. His house was built many years ago and it has been bad lately. In winter it has drafts and Chuluunbaatar uses the coal-fired stove to warm his house. This is bad for the health of his family members and the environment. 

He has been building a new family house in his land plot since last year. For this winter, he wanted to install an electric heating panel to the floor of his new house and he hopes it will be economical and healthy for the environment. 

The loan he is taking will be used to cover the cost of an electric floor-heating panel.

loans.use: To cover the cost of an electric floor-heating panel.

loans.name: Naomi Ruth

texts.en:
Naomi Ruth is a 38-year-old married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She has three young children and she is in a retailing business. She sells a health drink to people in her place. She has been in this business for more than three years now.
 
Naomi Ruth is in need of additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan worth 8,000 PHP to buy additional stocks to sell and to buy spare parts for their tricycle. With this, she will be able to enhance her income. 

Naomi dreams of making her business grow and become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell and spare parts for their tricycle.

loans.name: Tseveldulam

texts.en:
Tseveldulam, 49, is a watchman at the railway station. All of her children moved out and currently she lives alone in her old house in the ger district, an area of city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

In winter, her house becomes so cold due to the cold and heat loss. She uses the coal fired stove to warm her home, but it usually does not work well enough. 

She wants to install a water-heating line to her house. It is less harmful than the coal fired stove. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to cover the cost of building materials and hired workers to install a water-heating line to her house.

loans.use: To install a water-heating line to her house.

loans.name: Hul

texts.en:
Hul is a responsible mother who always dreams of uplifting her living standard and providing her children a better quality of life. She is 50 years old, married, and has four children, one married and three single. Currently, they are living together in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. 

Hul is raising this family with her untiring work in the rice fields. She wants to expand her plantation to increase her production each year. She has been involved in farming for more than 10 years. Hul’s husband shares his responsibilities for the family by working in the construction industry.

Hul is requesting a loan of 500 USD to buy a motorcycle for her husband's commute to the construction fields as well as for household use. She mentioned that this loan will be very useful for the support of the household's transportation needs. She believes that she will become successful in the future as she strives to works harder.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her husband's commute to the construction fields as well as for household use.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is a merchant living in Bohol, Philippines. She has been in a retailing business for more than 30 years now. She sells clothes, slippers and other household materials. 

Gaudiosa needs more capital for the expansion of her business. She is requesting a loan worth 20,000 PHP to buy additional stocks for her store such as ready-to-wear garments, slippers and others. With this, she will be able to cater to more customers in her place.

Gaudiosa dreams of making her business a successful one to generate more income to finance the family's daily needs. Any additional revenue will be used for reinvestment in the same business and for savings.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell such as ready-to-wear garments, slippers and others.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Madame Akou veuve de 57ans a 05 enfants. L’ainé à 38ans et le dernier 28ans. Elle vend des volailles au marché à ses clients. Pour  renforcer son activité et la rendre pérenne, elle sollicite de WAGES un neuvième prêt pour s’acheter des volailles (poules, canard…) afin de vendre et tirer de profit. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, l’agrandir et subvenir à ses moindres besoins. Elle est dans ce domaine il y a 24ans.
texts.en:
Akou is a 57-year-old widow with five children.  Her oldest child is 38 years old and the youngest is 28.

Akou sells poultry at the market to her customers.

In order to strengthen her activity and to make it sustainable, she is requesting a ninth loan from WAGES.  This loan will be used for the purchase of poultry (chickens and ducks), which will be sold at a profit.

She wants to reinvest in the activity, expand it, and be able to meet all her needs.  She has been working in this field for the past 24 years.

loans.use: to buy some poultry.

loans.name: Katherine Yuliana

texts.es:
Katherine es una mujer muy trabajadora, es madre de 2 pequeños de 2 y 6 años de edad, a quienes ama muchísimo y junto a su esposo dan la vida para poder darles una vida digna y sobre todo con mucho amor. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho leer y sobre todo disfrutar en algunas ocasiones de su platillo favorito el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pollo”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Enfermería.

Con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro Katherine inicio su negocio de venta de ropa y alquiler de disfraces, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el dia; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque le gusta lo que hace y sobre todo porque atiende de manera amable a los clientes.

Katherine está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería como ropa de invierno en especial pantalones, casacas, buzos, entre otros y también poder comprar un televisión y un DVD para poder publicitar los videos de los disfraces que alquila en su negocio, de esta manera tendrá más productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y poder mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, de esta manera ella podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una local más grande y darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Katherine is a very hardworking woman and a mother of two children aged 2 and 6 years old, who she loves you very much. Together with her husband she is dedicated to giving them a decent life, and above all a life with love. When she has free time, Katherine loves to read and occasionally enjoys her favorite dish which is tasty rice with chicken. Due to her limited financial resources she has only a secondary education, but would have liked to study nursing.

With much effort and savings, Katherine started her business selling clothes and renting costumes. She works about 8 hours each day and can serve up to 20 clients per day. She believes that her business is doing well because she loves what she does, and she is very friendly towards her customers.

Katherine is very grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help they have given, she will buy merchandise like winter clothes, particularly pants, jackets, sweatshirts, etc. and also a TV and a DVD player which she used to video advertise the costumes that she has. This loan will provide Katherine with more products to offer to her customers and improve her income and quality of life, so that she can continue struggling to realize his biggest dream: "Having a larger premises and giving a good education to her children. "

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as particularly pants, jackets, sweatshirts, etc.

loans.name: Wafurugu/alma Group

texts.es: Johana tiene 30 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Wafurugu/Alma, es casada pero no tiene hijos, ella y su esposo residen en Barrio Buenos Aires, en la Comunidad de Limón, Colon. Desde hace dos años inicio su negocio ya que con el esfuerzo de su trabajo a podido salir adelante, ella es una persona muy luchadora, y poco a poco ha hecho crecer su pulpería. Su horario de atención inicia a partir de las 6:00 a.m y culmina a las 8:00 p.m, su mayor ventaja es que tiene muy poca competencia. El préstamo lo necesita para surtir su negocio de productos como ser: refrescos, arroz, azúcar, carnes, pollo, aceite, entre otros. Ella espera que con el apoyo de este préstamo pueda tener su negocio surtido. Una de sus metas es tener una pulpería más grande para ofrecer a sus clientes todo lo que  necesiten. Este es el primer financiamiento que obtiene doña Johana en FAMA y espera cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Johana, 30 years old, is a member of the Wafurug/Alma Solidarity Group. She is married but has no children. She and her husband live in the Buenos Aires neighborhood in the community of Limón, Colon. Two years ago, she started a business and with the efforts of her hard work, she has been able to move forward. She has a fighting spirit, and little by little she has been able to grow her local store. Her operating hours are from 6am to 8pm, and her greatest advantage is that she has little competition. She needs the loan to stock business products such as drinks, rice, sugar, meat, chicken, oil, and other products. She hopes that with the help of this loan, she will be able to have her business fully stocked. One of her goals is to have a larger store so she can offer her clients everything they need. This is the first loan that Johana has taken out through FAMA and she hopes to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy general store products

loans.name: Joahr Group

texts.en:
This group is called Joahr and consists of five ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. 

Njod is a 26-year-old married woman who lives with her husband in Sana`a, Yemen. She is requesting a youth loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to improve the general condition of her home and to buy new furniture. She hopes that this will help improve her home for her family.

loans.use: to improve the general condition of her house and buy new furniture

loans.name: Burul

texts.ru:
Бурул 45 лет, замужем, имеет сына – школьника. В 2002 году в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Бурул начала свой бизнес в  животноводстве с начальной суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Бурул в качестве дохода от бизнеса смогла построить утепленные помещения для содержания скота. Муж Бурул работает водителем общественного транспорта. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бурул обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для реализации молока и молочных продуктов.   Доходы от кредита Бурул  планирует вложить в  расширение бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность в будущем оплатить обучение для сына.
texts.en:
Burul is 45 years old, married with one school-aged son. In 2002 in search of a source of income for her family, Burul started her own business in cattle rearing with the starting sum of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Burul with the income from the business was able to build winterized facilities for livestock. Burul's husband works as a driver of public transportation.  
 
In order to further develop her business, Burul turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of a dairy cow to generate milk and dairy products. 

With income from the loan, Burul plans to invest in expanding her business to be able to pay tuition for her son's education.

loans.use: to purchase cow

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Мадина жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей 27 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Мадина на протяжении шести лет занимается растениеводством. Она выращивает огурцы для продажи. Мадина имеет хороший опыт в этой сфере. Она берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Madina is a resident of the town of Tursunzade. She is 27 years old, married, and has three children. 

Madina has been engaged in agriculture for the last six years. She grows cucumbers for sale. Madina has good experience in this sphere. 

She is taking a loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru: Каромат 1959 года рождения,замужем имеет 4 детей. Она сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2010 года. Каромат работает в школе учителем, она преподает в начальных классах. Каромат всю свою жизнь работает учителем и ей ее профессия очень нравится.Она берет кредит на потребительские цели.Каромат хочет отремонтировать свою квартиру так как ее квартира нуждается в обновлении.Она долгое время мечтала улучшить свои условия проживания и создать комфорт в своем доме.Поэтому она решила получить кредит и осуществить свою мечту.Заранее благодарит за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Karomat was born in 1959. She is married with four children. Karomat works as an elementary schoolteacher. Karomat has worked as a teacher her whole life and she really likes her profession. 

She has been working with our organization since 2010. She is taking a loan for consumer purposes. Karomat wants to renovate her apartment because it is in need of updating. She has long dreamed of improving her living conditions and creating comfort in her home. Therefore, she decided to get a loan and fulfill her dream. Thank you for your financial support.

loans.use: to make home repairs

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is from the city of Mombasa. She’s the mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She’s married and is a merchant by trade, selling clothing from a small store set up in her home. She started this business with the help from her husband. Her husband is employed in one of the government institutions in the city.  They work together to get their family ahead. 

Bahati will use the money from this loan to buy 'khangas' (a type of fabric) and other clothing materials for sale. This is the type of merchandise she sells and she needs to stock her store. Her plans include expanding her store and adding new styles and sizes of clothing. Her goal is to prepare her children to become professionals; even as she aspires opening a boutique.

loans.use: to buy khangas (a type of fabric) and other clothing materials for sale.
